851.description: Updates Title 24 of the Hawaii Revised Statutes relating to health insurance. (HB926 HD1)

852.title: On-bill Financing; On-bill Repayment; Public Utilities Commission; Electric Utilities; Billing and Collections; Tax Exemption
852.description: Exempts electric utilities acting as billing and collections agents for an on-bill program from various State taxes and State laws regulating financial institutions, escrow depositories, or collection agencies. Effective 7/1/2112.

854.title: Hawaiian Home Lands; Affordable Housing Credits
854.description: Makes permanent Act 141, Sessions Laws of Hawaii 2009, which requires the county to issue affordable housing credits to the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands. Makes permanent Act 98, Session Laws of Hawaii 2012, which requires the counties to issue affordable housing credits for each residential unit developed by the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands.

855.title: Civil Service Exemption; Hawaii Public Housing Authority; Public Housing Renovations
855.description: Extends the exemption from state civil service for persons hired or contracted to repair and maintain vacant state housing units. Repeals requirement for termination or conversion to civil service status on July 1, 2015. (HB932 HD2)

856.title: Hospital Sustainability Program; Hospital Sustainability Program Special Fund
856.description: Amend Act 217, Session Laws of Hawaii 2012, as amended by Act 141, Session Laws of Hawaii 2013 and Act 123, Session Laws of Hawaii 2014, to continue the Hospital Sustainability Program by extending the sunset date of the Act, updating the referral dates in the statute, and to revise the funding amount for the hospital sustainability program for fiscal year 2015-2016. Effective June 29, 2015.

857.title: Nursing Facility Sustainability Program; Nursing Facility Sustainability Program Special Fund ($)
857.description: Amends Act 156, Session Laws of Hawaii 2012, as amended by Act 142, Session Laws of Hawaii 2013, and as amended by Act 124, Session Laws of Hawaii 2014, to continue the Nursing Facility Sustainability Program by extending the sunset date of the Act, updating the referral dates in the statute, and appropriating funding out of the nursing facility sustainability program special fund for fiscal year 2015-2016. Effective June 29, 2015.

858.title: Hawaii Public Housing Authority; Exemption From Works of Art Assessment
858.description: Exempts the Hawaii Public Housing Authority from the one per cent transfer of appropriated capital improvement funds to the Works of Art Special Fund.

859.title: Hawaii Public Housing Authority; Disposition of Property Abandoned, Seized, or Remaining at Federal and State Public Housing Properties
859.description: Expands the Hawaii Public Housing Authority's authority to dispose of property seized, abandoned, or remaining in federal, elder or elderly, or state low-income housing projects, including property remaining upon eviction.

860.title: Medicaid Managed Care Program
860.description: Replaces outdated references to QUEST and QUEST Expanded Access in the Hawaii Revised Statutes with the terms "medicaid managed care" or "medicaid managed care programs." (HB937 HD1)

861.title: General Support for General Assistance Payments (HMS 204); Emergency Appropriation ($)
861.description: Makes an emergency appropriation from the general revenues of the State of Hawaii for fiscal year 2014-2015 to address the budget shortfall for the general support for the General Assistance Program (HMS 204) in the Department of Human Services. (HB938 HD1)

862.title: Amendments to Birth Certificates, Establishment of Parenthood
862.description: Clarifies that amendments to birth records that change parenthood shall not be conducted through the Uniform Information Practices Act procedures to correct personal records, but must be pursuant to a court order of appropriate jurisdiction or other legal establishment of parenthood.

864.title: Water Infrastructure; Transfer of Funds
864.description: Establishes the authority to transfer federal capitalization grant funds between the Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund and the Drinking Water Treatment Revolving Loan Fund within the Department of Health, in accordance with the existing federal Safe Drinking Water Act, and as codified in Title 40 Code of Federal Regulations section 35.3530(c). Effective July 1, 2015.

865.title: Background Checks; Employees, Prospective Employees, Applicants, or Operators of Healthcare Facilities and the State Department of Health
865.description: Expand the authority of the Department of Health to conduct background checks to include criminal history record check, adult abuse perpetrator and child abuse record checks, and certified nurse aide registry record checks for persons seeking employment with the State or its contractors where the work involves direct client care, and applicants and operators of healthcare facilities.

866.title: Online Posting of Inspection Reports of Care Facilities
866.description: Extends the date by which the Department of Health must post inspection reports for state-licensed care facilities by six months and increases the number of days to post the reports, as recommended by a legislative task force.

867.title: Building Design Review, Disabilities and Communications Access Board
867.description: Exempts from mandatory review by the Disabilities and Communications Access Board certain construction projects constructed on state or county lands that would not ordinarily be open to public access.

868.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 610).
868.title: Fitness to Proceed; Hawaii State Hospital; Court Ordered Examination Reports
868.description: Creates consistency between statutes pertaining to unfit to proceed and acquit and commit regarding the Hawaii state hospital receiving copies of court ordered examination reports upon commitment to the hospital or conditional release. (SD1)

869.title: Hawaii Health Systems Corporation ($)
869.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to the Hawaii Health Systems Corporation. (HB948 HD1)

870.title: Emergency Appropriation; Hazard Evaluation and Emergency Response Preparedness. ($)
870.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to the Department of Health to support public health and environmental hazard evaluation and emergency response preparedness.

871.title: State Budget; Department of Labor and Industrial Relations
871.description: Amends a budget proviso for the Department of Labor and Industrial Relations to clarify the projected cost of annual vacation payouts by the Department during fiscal year 2014-2015.

872.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey excused (1).
872.title: Wage and Hour Law; Minimum Compensation Exemption
872.description: Increases the amount of guaranteed monthly compensation required to exempt an individual from minimum wage, overtime, and record keeping requirements under the Hawaii Wage and Hour Law. (HB953 HD1)

873.title: Transient Accommodations Tax; Special Land and Development Fund
873.description: Clarifies the distribution and allowable uses of Transient Accommodations Tax funds allocated and deposited into the Special Land and Development Fund in accordance with the Hawaii Tourism Authority's Strategic Plan.

874.title: Small Boat Harbors; Permit; Waitlist
874.description: Clarifies that a person at least eighteen years of age need not obtain a marine surveyor's inspection nor provide documentation that the person is the owner of a vessel in order to be placed on a waitlist for a use permit to moor a vessel in a state small boat harbor.

875.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Oshiro excused (2).
875.title: Special Shoreline Encroachment Easements
875.description: Provides the Board of Land and Natural Resources discretion to grant easements for less than fair market value for structures that were authorized by a governmental authority and legally constructed landward of the shoreline within the record boundary of the landward property at the time of construction, but are now located seaward of the valid certified shoreline on public land.

876.title: Forest Stewardship Program
876.description: Clarifies conditions that must be met by applicants to receive funds under the Forest Stewardship Program.

877.title: Cultural and Natural Resources; Civil Enforcement of Resource Violations
877.description: Provides alternative civil enforcement options that may be utilized by the Board of Land and Natural Resources in the processing of natural and cultural resource violation cases.

878.title: After-School Programs; Resources for Enrichment, Athletics, Culture, and Health Program
878.description: Establishes the R.E.A.C.H. (resources for enrichment, athletics, culture, and health) program in the Office of Youth Services to provide a framework and funding base for after-school programs in public middle and intermediate schools. Establishes a revolving fund to receive fees and other moneys to supplement the costs of administering and operating the program.

879.title: Commissioners of Deeds; Rules; Fees ($)
879.description: Adds new sections to chapter 503B, Hawaii Revised Statutes to clarify the Lieutenant Governor's rulemaking authority, authority to assess and collect fees and administrative fines, and to establish a revolving fund into which the fees and administrative fines are to be deposited. Amends chapter 503B, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to clarify that the Lieutenant Governor is responsible for the program and increases the surety bond requirement from $1,000 to $10,000.

880.title: Correctional Facilities; Court Orders to Provide Medical Treatment for Inmates and Detainees
880.description: Allows for a declaration to be filed with the petition as an alternative to an affidavit; expands the court's ability to continue the hearing on the petition for good cause; gives the court more flexibility in deciding when a guardian ad litem is necessary; changes the time requirement for filing for a court order for medical treatment from a period of within two days of an examination of the person to within five days; redefines the persons who must be notified of the petition; clarifies the effective expiration date of the order for persons who return to custody after release; and provides the ability for the department to seek an extension of an order to treat if necessary.

881.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act
881.description: Updates chapter 329, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to make it consistent with amendments in federal law on controlled substances; amends section 329-20 to add new controlled substances federally scheduled as required under section 329-11.

882.title: Public Safety
882.description: Includes misdemeanor offenses under chapter 134 (Firearms, Ammunition and Dangerous Weapons), Hawaii Revised Statutes, to the offenses that disqualify parolees from the provisions of Act 139, Session Laws of Hawaii 2012.

883.title: Income Tax; Conformity to the Internal Revenue Code for 2014
883.description: Conforms Hawaii income tax law with amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code as of December 31, 2014.

884.title: Estate and Generation-skipping Transfer Tax Reform Act
884.description: Conforms chapter 236E, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended as of December 31, 2014, and makes technical, nonsubstantive changes.

885.title: Income Tax; Vocational Rehabilitation Referrals
885.description: Amends section 235-55.91(e), Hawaii Revised Statutes, by updating references to the Internal Revenue Code.

886.title: Taxes; Liability for Amounts Passed on as Tax
886.description: Establishes that a taxpayer is liable for any amounts passed on and separately stated as the tax owed by the taxpayer for the transaction in a receipt, contract, invoice, billing, or other evidence of the business activity. Provides for civil penalty and reporting of violations to the department of commerce and consumer affairs. Takes effect 01/07/2059. (SD1)

887.title: Highway Fund; Driver Licensing Program; Maintenance Fee; Computer and Software Maintenance and Updates
887.description: Establishes a standard maintenance fee to be collected from all driver's license applicants to support computer and software maintenance and updates for the driver licensing program.

888.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday, 04-29-16 at 4:30PM in Conference Room 225.
888.title: Highway; Safety; Motor Vehicle Inspections; Motor Carrier Vehicle Inspections
888.description: Expands authority of the Director of Transportation over required motor vehicle and motor carrier vehicle inspections in the State including the authority to adopt rules to set fees. (SD2)

889.title: Aeronautics; Department of Transportation Rules; Dillingham Airfield
889.description: Clarifies the authority of the Department of Transportation at Dillingham Airfield.

890.title: Highway Safety; Ignition Interlock; Motor Vehicle
890.description: Amends the law for operating a vehicle under the influence of an intoxicant. Mandates the use of an ignition interlock for all offenders convicted and adjudicated for the offense of operating a vehicle under the influence of an intoxicant. Increases the fines for the violation. Removes the exemption for the repeat offender to drive without an ignition interlock if employed and required to drive a company vehicle for employment. Authorizes the director of transportation to make administrative rules governing the certification, monitoring, operation and compliance of the ignition interlock and authorizes penalties under these rules.

891.title: University of Hawaii; Rulemaking; Adoption of Regulations
891.description: Exempt certain adoption of regulations by the University of Hawaii from chapter 91, Hawaii Revised Statutes; require certain adoption of regulations by the University of Hawaii be subject to chapter 92, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

892.title: State Ethics Code; University of Hawaii
892.description: Clarifies application of State Ethics Code to technology transfer arrangements supported by the University of Hawaii. (HB975 HD1)

893.title: University of Hawaii-West Oahu; Revolving Fund ($)
893.description: Creates a conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii-West Oahu.

894.title: University of Hawaii; Accounting and Financial Management System
894.description: Amends the sunset provisions, with respect to the University of Hawaii, under sections 40-1, 40-2, 40-4, 40-6, 40-58, and 40-81, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

895.title: University of Hawaii, Appropriation ($)
895.description: To appropriate moneys out of the University of Hawaii Revenue Bond Fund for renovations, repairs, and improvements to the John A. Burns School of Medicine

896.title: Cybersecurity Employment Training; Appropriation ($)
896.description: Establishes a Cybersecurity Employment Training Initiative within the University of Hawaii Community College System; appropriates funds for the operation of the Initiative.

897.title: AG; Sexual Assault Collection Kits; Report
897.description: Requires the AG to conduct an inventory of all untested sexual assault collection kits in the possession of state or county law enforcement agencies; to develop and implement a plan to reduce the backlog of untested sexual assault collection kits; and to report to the legislature.

898.title: UH; College-Credit Equivalency Program; Work and Life Experience
898.description: Requires, rather than authorizes, UH to establish policies and procedures for the awarding of credits for college-level learning gained from work or other life experiences, other than military service covered under current law. Requires UH to report to the Legislature on its progress in awarding the college credits. (HB981 HD1)

899.title: Hawaii Farm-to-School Program; Farm-to-School Coordinator; Appropriation ($)
899.description: Establishes the Hawaii Farm-to-School Program and Farm-to-School Coordinator position. Appropriates moneys.

900.title: Health; Diabetes; Reporting
900.description: Requires DOH, in collaboration with DHS and DHRD, to develop departmental plans to reduce the incidence of diabetes in the State and submit reports to the legislature.

901.title: General Excise Tax; Food; Exemption
901.description: Exempts the sale of food from the general excise tax.

902.title: UH; Operating Costs; General Funds
902.description: Requires the UH to finance at least sixty per cent of its operating costs through general funds.

903.title: OIP; LG; DAGS; Transfer; Administrative Attachment; Attorneys; Civil Service; Appropriation ($)
903.description: Transfers OIP from LG to DAGS. Increases the independence of OIP as an administratively attached agency. Clarifies the employment status of OIP attorneys and the civil service exemption for OIP personnel. Appropriates funds to DAGS for administrative support.

904.title: Leaking Underground Storage Tank Fund; Red Hill Storage Tank Facility; Appropriation ($)
904.description: Appropriates moneys from the leaking underground storage tank fund to respond to and the repair of the leaking underground fuel storage tanks at the Red Hill fuel storage facility.

906.title: Albizia Trees; Invasive Species; Land Conservation Fund; Appropriation ($)
906.description: Amends the land conservation fund uses to allow for albizia tree removal. Makes an appropriation to DLNR for the removal of albizia trees on both public and private land.

907.title: State Finances; Program and Financial Plan; State Budget
907.description: Amends the six-year program and financial plan to a four-year program and financial plan. Codifies the statutorily implied mandate that the proposed executive budget submitted by the governor be balanced.

908.title: County Surcharge; Taxation; Income Tax; Excise Tax; Use Tax
908.description: Provides counties with home rule authority to set county surcharges on general excise, income, and use taxes. Allows funds collected via surcharge to be used for public projects.

909.title: SPRB; Special Purpose Revenue Bonds; Utilities; HECO ($)
909.description: Authorizes the issuance of special purpose revenue bonds to assist Hawaiian Electric Company, Inc., Maui Electric Company, Limited, and Hawaii Electric Light Company, Inc. (HD1)

910.title: Medical Marijuana; Patients; Registration; Physicians
910.description: Clarifies that a primary care or specialist physician may make the "written certification" necessary for medical use of marijuana. Requires that a certification form provided by DOH to register a medical marijuana patient and provide the patient's consent for the release of medical information shall specify that the consent applies to information from a primary care or specialist physician.

911.title: CIP; 43rd Representative District ($)
911.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the 43rd representative district.

912.title: Agriculture; Food Sustainability; On-Farm Mentoring; Future Farmers of America; 4-H; Appropriations ($)
912.description: Directs the DOA to provide grants to support existing whole system approach, on-farm mentoring programs. Appropriates funds as a grant for existing whole system approach, on-farm mentoring programs. Appropriates unspecified sums to the Future Farmers of America program and, as a grant, to the Hawaii 4-H Foundation to educate and support youth in agriculture careers. Takes effect 7/1/2112. (SD1)

913.title: BLNR; Mineral Resources; Geothermal Resources
913.description: Establishes a framework to regulate geothermal resources development through a permitting process administered by the BLNR and the appropriate county authority. Requires penalties, fees, and costs collected pursuant to chapter 182, HRS, to be deposited into the special land and development fund.

914.title: Chiropractic; Scope of Practice
914.description: Updates the scope of practice for chiropractic to reflect standards, practices, and terminology accepted by the National Board of Chiropractic Examiners.

915.title: Public Safety; Incarcerated Parent Data
915.description: Requires the Department of Public Safety to collect data on the number of incoming offenders into the state correctional system who are parents, the number of children they have that are under the age of eighteen, and any other relevant data that the Department deems useful to assist these at-risk children. (HB998 HD1)

916.title: Transient Accommodations Tax; Exemptions; Health Care Services
916.description: Exempts from the Transient Accommodations Tax, accommodations provided solely for use as temporary lodging by an individual, or the individual's immediate family members, spouse, or civil union partner while the individual is receiving health care services in a county in which the individual does not reside. (HB999 HD2)

917.title: Franchise; General Provisions; Forum
917.description: Voids franchise provisions that restrict the resolution of claims arising under or relating to a franchise in this State to a foreign forum. (HB1000 HD1)

918.title: Public Charter Schools; Charter Schools Commission
918.description: Amends the chapter governing public charter schools to align the requirements for start-up and conversion charter schools. Defines "applicant governing board" and makes conforming amendments. Makes other housekeeping amendments. (HB1001 HD1)

919.title: Capital Improvement Projects; 28th Representative District ($)
919.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 28th representative district.

920.title: Sand Island State Recreation Area; Appropriation ($)
920.description: Appropriates funds to the DLNR for infrastructure at the Sand Island State Recreation Area.

922.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 610).
922.title: Veterans Treatment Court; Appropriation ($)
922.description: Appropriates funds to the judiciary and the prosecuting attorney of the city and county of Honolulu to support the Veterans Treatment Court. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

923.title: Voting; Cellular Phones; Voting Modernization; Elections
923.description: Requires the Office of Elections to implement a voter modernization program allowing voters to vote via cellular phone.

924.last_action: The committee on HMS deferred the measure.
924.title: Blind Pedestrians; Safety
924.description: Requires the examination for a driver's license to test the applicant's knowledge of operating a vehicle in a manner that ensures the safety of blind or visually impaired pedestrians. (HB1008 HD1)

925.title: Special Interest Vehicle; Antique Motor Vehicle
925.description: Redefines "special interest vehicle" to mean a motor vehicle that, based on its model year, is at least 25 years old. (HB1009 HD1)

927.title: Wild or Exotic Animal; Unlawful Display or Performance
927.description: Requires disclosure of Animal Welfare Act violations for a permit to import wild and exotic animals. Prohibits use, display, and performance of wild and exotic animals that have been confined in a mobile or traveling housing facility. (HB1012 HD1)

928.title: Right to Try Act; Experimental Treatments
928.description: Establishes the Right to Try Act. Authorizes manufacturers to make investigational drugs, biological products, or devices available to terminally ill patients who have given written, informed consent. Exempts from liability and sanctions, persons who are involved in a patient's participation in experimental treatments for a terminal illness. (HB1013 HD3)

929.title: Penal Code; Multiple Sentences of Imprisonment
929.description: Requires multiple terms of imprisonment imposed on a defendant who is already subject to an unexpired term of imprisonment that was imposed prior to 6/18/2008 to run concurrently unless the terms are mandated by the court or statute to run consecutively. Authorizes multiple terms of imprisonment imposed on or after the effective date of this Act to run concurrently unless the terms are mandated by the court or statute to run consecutively.

930.title: Fighting or Baiting Animals; Penalty
930.description: Increases the fighting or baiting of animals from a misdemeanor to a class C felony.

931.title: Housing Vouchers; Classroom Teachers
931.description: Authorizes the Department of Education to establish a housing voucher program for full-time classroom teachers employed by the Department of Education, including classroom teachers at public charter schools in the State. (HB1016 HD1)

932.title: Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act; Residential Mortgage Loans; Seller Financing
932.description: Restores the exemptions from the Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act for individuals who offer or negotiate the terms of a residential mortgage loan with or on behalf of an immediate family member or for the individual's own residence. Effective 01/01/2112. (HD1)

933.title: Kalaeloa Airport; Tenant Advisory Board
933.description: Establishes a Kalaeloa airport tenant advisory board.

934.title: Public Employment; Election Candidates; Mandatory Leave of Absence Without Pay
934.description: Prohibits public employers from placing employees on leave of absence without pay because of the employee's status as a candidate for elective public office. Includes exceptions for leaves of absence requested by the employee, where the employer proves that the employee's candidacy substantially interferes with the performance of duties, or if the employee lacks a sufficient amount of accumulated vacation leave.

935.title: Hawaii Community Development Authority; Affordable Housing; Reserved Housing; Workforce Housing; Affordable Workforce Housing
935.description: Requires HCDA to establish rules to require reserved and workforce housing in developments. Amends definition of reserved housing and creates definition of workforce housing. Provides for establishing rules for the rental of reserved and workforce housing.

936.title: Hawaii Community Development Authority; Public Hearings; Contested Cases
936.description: Adds a definition for "contested case". Amends the deadline to intervene in a proceeding to accept a developer's proposal to thirty days after the first public hearing on a developer's proposal. Requires HCDA to make certain findings on the proposed project and its impacts, including concerns expressed by community residents and stakeholders, in order to approve the proposed development. Requires developers to abide by all representations and commitments made in the permit application process.

937.title: Hawaii Community Development Authority; Kakaako Makai; Shoreline Protection; Parkland
937.description: Requires the Hawaii community development authority to set aside certain parcels of land in Kakaako makai for shoreline protection and parkland development.

938.title: HCDA; Leases; Terms; Public Meeting
938.description: Reduces the maximum term for which the HCDA may lease property from 65 years to 30 years. Subjects leases entered into by the HCDA to public auction and public notice for sealed bids. Provides that the HCDA may extend leases upon determining that there are no adverse impacts on the land. Requires the HCDA to conduct a public meeting prior to entering into any lease that is 10 years or more.

939.title: CIP; 26th Representative District ($)
939.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects to benefit the 26th Representative District.

940.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 610).
940.title: Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation; Executive Director Salary
940.description: Authorizes the HHFDC Board of Directors to set the salary of its Executive Director in an amount not to exceed that of the salary of the Director of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

941.title: Department of Taxation; Income Tax Check-Off; State Income Tax Refund; Rental Housing Trust Fund
941.description: Requires the department of taxation to allow a taxpayer to designate or "check-off" that a specified amount of the taxpayer's income tax refund be paid to the rental housing trust fund. Applies to taxable years beginning after 12/31/15.

942.title: Traffic Infractions; State Reserve Lands
942.description: Decriminalizes traffic infractions within natural area reserves and forest reserves of the Department of Land and Natural Resources.

943.title: Procurement Code; Special Innovative Procurement
943.description: Provides for the establishment of a special innovative procurement process for the procurement of supplies, services, professional services, or construction. Requires the establishment of procedures by the procurement policy board for use of the special innovative procurement process. (HB1028 HD2)

944.title: Endangered Species Recovery Committee; University of Hawaii at Manoa College of Natural Sciences.
944.description: Amends the composition of the Endangered Species Recovery Committee by replacing the University of Hawaii Environmental Center's Director with the Dean of the University of Hawaii at Manoa College of Natural Sciences. (SD1)

945.title: Short form; Workforce Development
945.description: Short form bill relating to workforce development.

946.title: Short form; Employees' Retirement System
946.description: Short form bill relating to the employees' retirement system.

947.title: Short form; Hawaii Employer-Union Health Benefits Trust Fund
947.description: Short form bill relating to the Hawaii employer-union health benefits trust fund.

948.title: Short form; Public Employees
948.description: Short form bill relating to public employees.

949.title: Short form; Government Operations
949.description: Short form bill relating to government operations.

950.title: Elections; Automatic Recounts by Hand
950.description: Requires automatic recounts by hand of general election votes, the scope of which depends on the margin of victory.

951.title: Elections; Mandatory Recount of Votes
951.description: Requires automatic recounts of election votes for narrow margins of victory. For particularly narrow vote differentials, requires manual recounts by hand or by an alternative method agreed to by the two candidates garnering the most votes.

952.title: Pilot Program; Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program; Appropriation ($)
952.description: Establishes a 3-year pilot program for organizations to assist applicants for supplemental nutrition assistance program. Creates an incentive to submit applications online. Appropriates moneys for the pilot program.

954.title: Appropriation; UH; Local and Immigrant Farmer Education Program ($)
954.description: Appropriates moneys to the Local and Immigrant Farmer Education Program of the UH College of Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources Cooperative Extension Service to support the growth and sustainability of the agriculture industry.

955.title: Invasive Species; Mitigation; Economic Model Formula; Appropriation ($)
955.description: Appropriates moneys to the HISC to contract with UHERO to establish an economic model formula to establish the impact and cost of mitigating the most significant invasive species in the State. Directs LRB to update its 2002 study to reflect costs and impact of mitigation efforts. (SD1)

956.title: Department of Land and Natural Resources; Hunting; Game Management Advisory Commission; Report; Appropriation ($)
956.description: Establishes the Game Management Advisory Commission to serve in an advisory capacity to the Board of Land and Natural Resources. Appropriates funds. (HB1041 CD1)

957.last_action: Received notice of all Senate conferees being discharged (Sen. Com. No. 647).
957.title: Important Agricultural Lands; Counties; Grants-in-Aid; Appropriation ($)
957.description: Appropriates funds for grants-in-aid to the counties for identifying and mapping important agricultural lands, preparing the final submission package to the land use commission, and assistance with exploring county incentives for important agricultural lands. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (SD1)

958.title: CIP; 29th Representative District ($)
958.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 29th Representative District.

959.title: Sexual Assault in the Second Degree; Sexual Assault in the Fourth Degree; Sexual Penetration; Sexual Contact; Minor
959.description: Amends the offense of sexual assault in the second degree to include a person who knowingly subjects to sexual penetration with a minor at least sixteen years of age and the person is contemporaneously acting in a professional capacity to instruct, advise, or supervise the minor, with certain exceptions. Amends the offense of sexual assault in the fourth degree to include a person who engages in or causes sexual contact with a minor at least sixteen years of age and the person is contemporaneously acting in a professional capacity to instruct, advise, or supervise the minor, with certain exceptions. (SD1)

960.title: Public Assistance; Residency Requirement
960.description: Requires an applicant or recipient of public assistance to be a resident of the State for at least 4 months.

963.title: Elections; Reemployment Rights; Public Employees
963.description: Establishes reemployment rights for public employees who resign in order to seek elective office.

965.title: Invasive Species; Interisland Movement; Department of Agriculture; Audit; Appropriations ($)
965.description: Mandates the Department of Agriculture to perform specified tasks to address the interisland spread of invasive species. Requires annual report. Requires the Auditor to audit the Plant Quarantine Branch. Makes appropriations. (HB1050 CD1)

966.title: Department of Agriculture; Rulemaking; Declaration of Hawaii Geographic Indication
966.description: Authorizes the DOA to adopt rules relating to the declaration of Hawaii geographic indication for agricultural commodities. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

967.title: Employer-Union Health Benefits Trust Fund; Board of Trustees
967.description: Amends the membership, term length, and quorum requirements of the EUTF board of trustees

968.title: Coffee Berry Borer; Pesticide Subsidy Program; Appropriations ($)
968.description: Appropriates funds for the pesticide subsidy program to eradicate the coffee berry borer.

969.title: Audiovisual Technology; Videoconferencing; Legislative Hearings; Testimony; Teleconferencing; Hawaii County ($)
969.description: Requires the House of Representatives to implement rules for a pilot program to enable the house to receive live oral testimony from the County of Hawaii through audio or audiovisual technology. Requires consultation with the County of Hawaii, the chief information officer, and the Disability and Communication Access Board. Appropriates moneys. (HB1054 HD1)

970.title: Voter Registration; Social Security Number; Driver's License Number; State Identification Number
970.description: Requires on an application to register to vote, a Hawaii driver's license number or a Hawaii state identification card number or, if no license or identification card has been issued, the last four digits of the applicant's social security number. If the applicant does not have a social security number, requires an election official or county clerk to assign the applicant a unique number for voter registration purposes. Takes effect on 1/1/2018. (SD1)

971.title: Agriculture; Regulation; Labeling; Hawaii Grown Origin Products Commission; Established ($)
971.description: Establishes the Hawaii Grown Origin Products Commission to identify and regulate the labeling of selected products grown or produced in Hawaii. Establishes the Hawaii Grown Origin Products Special Fund. Makes appropriations.

972.title: Felony sexual assault of a minor less than fourteen years; mandatory minimum sentencing
972.description: Establishes a mandatory minimum sentence of twenty years for class A felony of first degree sexual assault of a minor who is less than fourteen years of age.

973.title: Airport hangar storage
973.description: Replaces criminal penalties for storing materials in airport hangars by individuals engaged in commercial activities at public airports with an appropriate civil penalty.

974.title: Powdered Alcohol; Study; DOH; Report; Appropriation ($)
974.description: Requires DOH to conduct a study regarding the risks associated with the consumption of powdered alcohol products and to report its findings to the legislature. Makes an appropriation.

975.title: Jury Duty; Exemptions; Age
975.description: Allows a person 70 years of age or older to claim an exemption from jury duty beginning 1/1/16.

977.title: General Excise Tax; Medical Services
977.description: Exempts medical services from the general excise tax.

978.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 610).
978.title: Emergency Medical Care; Appropriation ($)
978.description: Appropriates moneys to operate an additional emergency medical services unit in the Moanalua, Aliamanu, Red Hill, Salt Lake, and Foster Village areas. Effective 7/1/2060. (SD1)

979.title: CIP; 23rd Representative District ($)
979.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the 23rd representative district.

980.title: School Year; Instructional Time
980.description: Repeals provisions of section 302A-251, HRS, relating to student instructional hours. Removes definition of "student instructional hours" from SLH. Applies to collective bargaining agreements executed on or after effective date.

981.title: Junior Kindergarten; Appropriation ($)
981.description: Requires the Department of Education to re-establish the junior kindergarten program. Requires junior kindergarten classrooms to be established on all Department of Education public elementary school campuses beginning with the 2018-2019 school year.

982.title: Public Agency Meetings
982.description: Allows county council members to jointly attend and speak at particular types of meetings.

983.title: Tax Credit; High Technology
983.description: Allows for a credit for all qualified research expenses without regard to the amount of expenses for previous years.

984.title: Incubation; Appropriation; Hawaii Strategic Development Corporation; High Technology Development Corporation ($)
984.description: Appropriates funds to the Hawaii Strategic Development Corporation to continue developing the HI Growth Initiative. Appropriates funds to the High Technology Development Corporation to facilitate the development and growth of Hawaii's commercial high technology industry. (HB1070 HD1)

985.title: Revision Bill
985.description: Amending or repealing various provisions of the Hawaii Revised Statutes and the Session Laws of Hawaii for the purposes of correcting errors and references, clarifying language, and deleting obsolete or unnecessary provisions. (HB1071 HD1)

986.last_action: Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 715).
986.title: Prescribing Psychologists; Prescriptive Authority Privilege
986.description: Authorizes and establishes procedures and criteria for prescriptive authority for clinical psychologists who meet specific education, training, and registration requirements, including that the prescribing psychologist practices in a county with a population of less than 500,000. Requires the Board of Psychology to report to the Legislature prior to the regular session of 2020. Sunsets August 31, 2024. (HB1072 CD1)

987.title: Income Tax; Physicians and Osteopathic Physicians; Relocation Tax Credit
987.description: Establishes a temporary income tax exemption for physicians and osteopathic physicians who relocate and practice in Hawaii.

988.title: Driver Licensing; Violations; Evidence; Defense
988.description: Provides that a driver's inability to produce an appropriate driver's license or permit upon request by a law enforcement officer shall be prima facie evidence of a violation. Provides that holding an appropriate license or permit shall be an affirmative defense.

989.title: UH Tuition Waivers; Military; Spouses and Children
989.description: Allows UH and the community colleges to waive tuition for spouses and children of totally disabled veterans and active or reserve members of the armed forces who were killed in action.

990.title: Truth-in-Advertising; License; Locally Produced
990.description: Requires farmers' market operators to procure a license to ensure that greater than 50 per cent of vendors in farmers' markets primarily sell food, farm produce, or flowers prepared, grown, or produced in Hawaii.

991.title: Hawaii Public Housing Authority; Waste Diversion
991.description: Clarifies that HPHA is authorized to contract with private businesses to remove food and green wastes from public housing projects.

992.title: Petty Misdemeanor; Forfeiture
992.description: Authorizes the forfeiture of any property used or taken in any violation of laws or rules that results in a petty misdemeanor.

993.title: Urban Water Conservation; Best Management Practices; Public Agency; Appropriation ($)
993.description: Establishes a four-year pilot program requiring DAGS to implement irrigation water conservation best management practices, as established by the Landscape Industry Council of Hawaii and report to the Legislature.  Makes an appropriation.

994.title: CIP; 27th Representative District ($)
994.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 27th representative district.

995.title: Absentee Voting
995.description: Requires all registered voters age 75 and older to automatically be permanent absentee voters voting by absentee ballot.

996.title: Candidate Committee Reporting Deadlines
996.description: Requires additional candidate committee reporting deadlines for candidates for election.

997.title: Lobbyists; Gifts; Rewards; Public Official
997.description: Prohibits lobbyists from giving gifts to officials in the legislative or executive branch that may be inferred to be intended to influence an official's actions in the performance of the official's duties or intended as a reward for an official's actions in the performance of the official's duties.

998.title: Political Sign; Restrictions
998.description: Defines political sign. Restricts the posting of political signs.

999.title: Environmental Reorganization; Update LRB Study; Appropriation ($)
999.description: Requires LRB to update its 1985 study on environmental reorganization for Hawaii and assess the feasibility of implementing the findings and recommendations of the 1992 department of environmental protection task force. Makes an appropriation. (SD1)

1000.title: Environmental Response Revolving Fund; Barrel Tax
1000.description: Changes the amount of the barrel tax deposited into the Environmental Response Revolving Fund from 5 cents per barrel to an unspecified amount to support environmental activities and programs. (SD1)

1001.title: Net-zero-energy Consumption; State Facilities; Working Group; Benchmarking Study
1001.description: Establishes a working group to develop a short-term, five-year plan for net-zero-energy consumption for all public infrastructure owned by the State. Requires DBEDT to perform a benchmarking study on the energy use of all state facilities.

1002.title: Motor Vehicles; Certificates of Inspection
1002.description: Requires motor vehicle safety inspections to be conducted every two years rather than annually for vehicles registered in a county with a population of three hundred thousand or less. (HB1089 HD2)

1003.title: Income Tax; Standard Deduction; Personal Exemption
1003.description: Increases the standard deduction and allowable personal exemption amounts for all filing statuses. Increases the number of exemptions that may be claimed by taxpayers who are 65 years of age or older and meet certain income requirements. (HB1091 HD1)

1004.title: Deferred Compensation Retirement Plans; Income Tax Exclusion
1004.description: Excludes income received from deferred compensation retirement plans from the state income tax for taxpayers who meet certain income requirements. (HB1092 HD1)

1005.title: Safety Inspection; Mufflers; Exhaust; Noise
1005.description: Requires motor vehicle safety inspection stations to inspect motor scooter exhaust pipes or mufflers and motor vehicle mufflers to ensure that the noise emitted meets certain requirements. Provides penalties for inspection stations that issue safety inspection certificates in violation of muffler and exhaust requirements.

1006.title: Mopeds; Registration; Safety Inspections; Safety Courses; Fines
1006.description: Requires annual registration and inspection of mopeds. Requires operators of mopeds to enroll in safety courses in order to operate their mopeds. Increases the fine for modifying a moped to $1,000. Prevents registration or transfer of title of a moped if traffic infraction fines are outstanding.

1007.title: Rental Housing Trust Fund; Subaccounts; County Funded Projects
1007.description: Authorizes the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation, upon request by a county, to establish and operate for the county, a county rental housing subaccount within the Rental Housing Trust Fund.

1008.title: Residential Mortgage Loans; Mortgage Loan Originator Companies; Posted Business Hours; Regular Business Hours
1008.description: Specifies that mortgage loan originator companies shall be open for business to the public during posted business hours, at least some of which shall be during regular business hours. (SD1)

1009.title: Residential Mortgage Loans; Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act; Sole Proprietorships
1009.description: Amends the definition of "sole proprietorship" for individual mortgage loan originators subject to the Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act to repeal the qualifier that there be no legal distinction between the individual mortgage loan originator business owner and the business.

1010.title: Mortgage Loan Origination Licensees; Mortgage Loan Recovery Fund Target Balance and Fee Collection
1010.description: Authorizes the Commissioner of Financial Institutions to make adjustments to the collection of fees for the Mortgage Loan Recovery Fund without regard to chapter 91, HRS, to better maintain the intended $750,000 balance in the Mortgage Loan Recovery Fund. (HB1098 HD2)

1012.title: Invasive Species; Update LRB Study; Appropriation
1012.description: Requires LRB to update the economic and environmental costs component of its 2002 study on invasive species. Makes an appropriation.

1013.title: Department of Taxation; Tax Collection; Study
1013.description: Requires DOTAX to conduct a study on modernizing the state tax collection system and submit a report to the legislature. (HB1102 HD1)

1014.title: DLNR; Appropriation; Marine Regulation and Policy Specialist ($)
1014.description: Appropriates moneys to create a permanent full-time marine regulation and policy specialist position in the division of aquatic resources of DLNR.

1015.title: Energy; Fuel Cell Electric Vehicles; Non-fossil Fuels ($)
1015.description: Requires the State and counties to purchase an unspecified percentage of fuel cell electric vehicles (FCEV) in their total annual purchase or acquisition of government motor vehicles. Requires the directors of finance to track and report to the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism (DBEDT) the number of FCEV registered in the State. Requires fuel distributors to report to DBEDT the volume of non-fossil fuels imported or produced for ultimate sale or consumption in the State.

1016.title: Department of Education; Weighted Student Formula
1016.description: Allows for several factors to be weighted for the weighted student formula including but not limited to student characteristics, enrollment trends, and optimal student-teacher ratios. Requires the committee on weights to incorporate into the weighted student formula weights that account for special education teachers and support staff, enrollment increases, and the optimal student-teacher ratio at each grade level.

1017.title: CIP; 4th Representative District ($)
1017.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates moneys for capital improvement projects in the 4th representative district.

1018.title: Bookmobile; Big Island; Educational Materials; Hawaii State Public Library System; Appropriation ($)
1018.description: Appropriates funds for the establishment and maintenance of a bookmobile that shall serve the rural areas of the island of Hawaii. (HB1107 HD1)

1019.title: Mandatory Health Insurance Coverage; Autism Spectrum Disorders
1019.description: Requires health insurers, mutual benefit societies, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for autism spectrum disorder treatments. (HB1108 HD1)

1020.title: Behavior Support Review Committee for Persons with Developmental and Intellectual Disabilities
1020.description: Describes the behavioral support review process for multidisciplinary reviews of restraints or seclusion of persons with developmental or intellectual disabilities. Exempts those who participate in the reviews from liability for authorized disclosure of information. (HB1109 HD1)

1021.title: Oral Health Status; Comprehensive Assessment; Appropriation
1021.description: Requires the Department of Health to develop a comprehensive assessment of Hawaii's oral health status. Appropriates funds.

1023.last_action: Received notice of all Senate conferees being discharged (Sen. Com. No. 647).
1023.title: Hawaii Health Systems Corporation; Audit; Collective Bargaining; Transition; Appropriation ($)
1023.description: Repeals certain limits on operational authority. Requires the auditor to conduct a financial and management audit of HHSC every five years. Authorizes HHSC to negotiate master collective bargaining agreements for its employees. Authorizes a regional system of the Hawaii health systems corporation, in collaboration with a private entity, to transition any one or more of its facilities to management and operation by a new nonprofit management entity. Appropriates an unspecified amount to the department of budget and finance for an unspecified number of positions to coordinate the review of documents and examine the fiscal implications posed by a transition of any Hawaii health systems corporation facility to management and operation by a nonprofit management entity. Effective 1/7/2059. (SD2)

1024.title: Environmental Response Revolving Fund; Wildlife Emergency Response
1024.description: Allows the environmental response revolving fund to be used to support the operations of an environmental disaster standby and response facility in the State that shall be responsible for the recovery and rehabilitation of native wildlife that are sickened, injured, or contaminated as a result of an oil- or fuel-related disaster in the State.

1025.title: Historic Preservation; Works of Art Special Fund; Use ($)
1025.description: Authorizes the use of moneys in the works of art special fund to be used for preventive maintenance, repair, rehabilitation, or restoration of the Bernice Pauahi Bishop Museum, Iolani Palace, Washington Place, Royal Mausoleum at Mauna Ala, No. 1 Capitol District Building, and the state capitol.

1026.title: Adult Residential Care Homes; Domiciliary Care Facilities; State Supplemental Payment
1026.description: Amends the state supplemental payment amounts for specified types of adult residential care homes and other domiciliary care facilities and provides for annual adjustment. Changes the public assistance allowance to an unspecified percentage of the current federal poverty level.

1027.title: Community Care Foster Family Homes; Caregivers; Minimum Age; Continuing Education
1027.description: Amends the minimum age and continuing education requirements for primary and substitute caregivers caring for three clients in community care foster family homes in the rules required to be adopted by the Department of Health.

1028.title: Community Health Care Facilities and Case Managers; Department of Health Late Payments; Interest
1028.description: Requires the Department of Health to pay interest on late payments to community health care facilities and case managers, and report back to the Legislature.

1029.title: Memorial; Persian Gulf War; Operation Desert Storm; Operation Iraqi Freedom; Operation Enduring Freedom; Operation New Dawn
1029.description: Directs the Office of Veterans' Services, with the assistance of the Department of Accounting and General Services, Department of Defense, and State Historic Preservation Division, to develop a plan to establish a memorial honoring the veterans of the Persian Gulf War, Operation Desert Storm, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Enduring Freedom, and Operation New Dawn. Requires a report to the Legislature by January 1, 2016.

1030.title: Filipino Veterans; Burial Grants; Appropriation ($)
1030.description: Appropriates funds for burial grants for qualifying Filipino veterans to provide funeral and burial services and transportation of their remains to the Philippines.

1031.title: Procurement Code; Veteran-Owned and Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses; Set Aside
1031.description: Requires that a percentage of the annual purchasing expenditure of the State set-aside for small businesses be awarded to veteran-owned and service-disabled veteran-owned small businesses, in addition to any other preferences provided under the Procurement Code for such businesses.

1032.title: Education; Tuition Incentives; Early High School Graduation
1032.description: Provides tuition incentives for public school students who complete their high school's graduation requirements before grade 12 and attend a college within the University of Hawaii system.

1033.title: Education; High School Graduation Requirements; Citizenship Exam
1033.description: Requires students to pass the United States citizenship exam in order to receive a high school diploma.

1034.title: Energy Resources; Solar Water Heater Systems; Retrofits
1034.description: Requires existing single-family homes to be retrofitted with solar water heater systems. Allows for a tax credit or loan for compliance. Authorizes the PUC to permit electrical utilities to collect a surcharge for non-compliance, to be deposited into the Hawaii green infrastructure special fund.

1035.title: Psychologists; Practice of Psychology; Applied Psychologists; Exemptions; Powers and Duties
1035.description: Adds definitions for "applied psychologist", "health service provider", and "general applied psychologist". Amends definitions of "practice of psychology" and "psychologist". Clarifies license and exemption requirements for psychologists. Amends powers and duties of the board of psychology.

1036.title: Psychologist; Licensure; Post Doctoral Training Requirement
1036.description: Removes the requirement that applicants for a license in psychology complete one year of post doctoral training and replaces it with required hours of supervised experience during the doctoral degree program.

1037.title: Procurement; State Procurement Office; Database; Oversight ($)
1037.description: Requires the state procurement office to establish a database of all government procurement contracts, accessible to each governmental entity. Requires state procurement office oversight of procurement information. Appropriates funds to establish the database. (HB1126 HD1)

1038.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 610).
1038.title: Procurement; Procurement Officers; Education and Training; Appropriation ($)
1038.description: Requires all procurement officers of state and county governmental bodies to attend initial training by the State Procurement Office and regular follow-up training as determined by the State Procurement Office. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1039.title: Agricultural Land; Dwellings; Employee Housing
1039.description: Limits dwellings and employee housing on agricultural land to farmers and immediate family members. Establishes standards for dwellings and employee housing on agricultural land.

1040.title: Law Enforcement Officers; Firearms; Alcohol
1040.description: Prohibits law enforcement officers from consuming any amount of alcohol while in the possession on their person or control of a firearm.

1041.title: Elections; Online Voting; Appropriation ($)
1041.description: Establishes a process for online voting by any registered voter for any election. Appropriates moneys to implement the process.

1042.title: Campaign Contributions; Lobbyist
1042.description: Prohibits a candidate or candidate committee from accepting more than twenty per cent of its total contributions from lobbyists during an election period. Prohibits a lobbyist from contributing more than an aggregate $20,000 to all candidates and candidate committees during an election period.

1043.title: Minimum Wage; Living Wage; Tip Credit; Consumer Price Index
1043.description: Establishes the minimum wage annually pursuant to the consumer price index. Adjusts the tip credit annually according to adjustments in the living wage.

1044.title: Tax-Free Zones; DBEDT; Study
1044.description: Requires DBEDT to conduct a study on the establishment of tax-free zones in Hawaii.

1045.title: Judiciary; Third Circuit; Hookele; Appropriations ($)
1045.description: Appropriates moneys for equipment, supplies, and salaries for Hookele legal self-help service centers in Hilo and Kona.

1046.title: Net Energy Metering Tax Credit
1046.description: Establishes a nonrefundable income tax credit for taxpayers who participate in net energy metering and have unused credits for excess electricity that lapse before the credits can be applied to the taxpayer's utility bill.

1047.title: DOCARE; Conservation; Memorandum of Understanding, Report
1047.description: Requires DOCARE to facilitate the execution of a memorandum of understanding for the joint enforcement of conservation laws, rules, and ordinances. Requires DOCARE to submit a report to the legislature. Sunsets on 6/30/16.

1048.title: Use Tax; Post-Employment Benefits Trust; Pension Accumulation Fund
1048.description: Increases use tax paid by wholesalers from .5% to 1.5% by one per cent and applies the increase to reduce the State's unfunded liabilities for the EUTF and ERS.

1049.title: Albizia Trees; Pest Inspection, Quarantine, and Eradication Fund; Appropriation ($)
1049.description: Makes an appropriation from the pest inspection, quarantine, and eradication fund to DOA for the removal of albizia trees on public and private land.

1050.title: CIP; 20th Representative District ($)
1050.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the 20th representative district.

1051.title: Cesspool; Prohibition; Department of Health
1051.description: Prohibits new installation of a cesspool and new construction served by a cesspool after December 31, 2016. Authorizes the department of health to develop rules for exceptions. (SD1)

1052.title: CIP; 6th Representative District ($)
1052.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the sixth representative district.

1053.title: Environmental Impact Statement; Lead Agency
1053.description: Establishes the definition of "lead agency" and provides that no other agency shall approve an action until the lead agency has accepted a final environmental impact statement.

1054.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
1054.title: Constitutional Amendment; Rights of Victims of Crime (ConAm)
1054.description: Proposes an amendment to the Hawaii State Constitution to provide victims of crime with specific rights related to the criminal justice process. (HB1144 HD1)

1055.title: Hawaii Health Systems Corporation
1055.description: Authorizes the Hawaii Health Systems Corporation to mortgage its real property and clarifies the dollar cap on municipal leasing authority.

1056.title: Hawaii Health Systems Corporation; Collective Bargaining Units
1056.description: Creates seven separate collective bargaining units for employees of the Hawaii Health Systems Corporation.

1057.title: Emergency Services Failsafe Program; Medical Services; Emergency Room; Forum for Patient Advocacy ($)
1057.description: Establishes a two-year pilot emergency services failsafe program to assist physicians and patients in obtaining a second medical opinion regarding diagnosis and treatment. Authorizes the Department of Health to convene a committee to create a forum related to patient advocacy in the emergency department setting. Appropriates funds for the pilot program. (HB1147 HD1)

1058.title: Elections; Voting; Hours
1058.description: Changes the closing time of polling places on election day to 7:00 p.m.

1059.title: Veterans; Disability; Driver's License; Identification Cards
1059.description: Establishes the designation of "one hundred per cent disabled veteran" on drivers' licenses, instruction permits, and civil identification cards. Effective 1/1/2016.

1060.title: CIP; 38th Representative District ($)
1060.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 38th representative district.

1061.title: Salvaged Motor Vehicles; Salvage Certificate; Insurance
1061.description: Allows for the issuance of a salvage certificate for a motor vehicle without a certificate of ownership.

1062.title: Drugs; Use of Intoxicants While Operating a Vehicle
1062.description: Includes any substance that can impair a person's ability to operate a vehicle in the definition of "drug" for purposes of defining the offense of operating a vehicle under the influence of drugs or alcohol.

1063.title: Disabled Persons Parking; Funding
1063.description: Increases the state vehicle registration fee, with proceeds to be deposited into the Disability and Communication Access Board Special Fund to cover the costs of administering the parking program for persons with disabilities. (HB1154 HD1)

1064.title: Albizia Trees; Conservation and Resources Enforcement Special Fund; Appropriation ($)
1064.description: Makes an appropriation from the conservation and resources enforcement special fund to DLNR for the removal of albizia trees on public and private land.

1065.title: Pacific Remote Islands Marine National Monument; Journey; Appropriation ($)
1065.description: Appropriates funds for a journey through the Pacific Remote Islands Marine National Monument and for the production of a television series, books, and other educational materials about this journey. Requires matching funds. (HB1156 HD1)

1066.title: District Courts; Civil Actions; Jurisdiction; Specific Performance
1066.description: Raises the district courts' jurisdictional limit for civil actions involving specific performance.

1067.title: Sustainable Business Corporations; Copyright; Trademark; Intellectual Property
1067.description: Adds the use of a copyright or trademark for the purpose of job creation or upholding fair labor standards as a specific public benefit for which a sustainable business corporation can be created.

1068.title: Board of Education; Standardized Testing; Public Schools
1068.description: Requires the BOE to administer standardized tests early in the school year in order to use the tests to inform instruction in the school year in which the test is administered. Establishes conditions for standardized testing. Requires periodic audits of standardized testing protocols and reports to the legislature and the governor.

1069.title: Freedom of Religion; Rights
1069.description: Prohibits the State or any county from burdening any person's right to exercise religion absent that burden being the least restrictive means of furthering a compelling governmental interest.

1070.title: Community Health Centers; Appropriations; Affordable Care Act; Medicaid; Health Homes; Med-QUEST Programs; Healthcare ($)
1070.description: Appropriates funds to the department of human services to restore basic adult dental benefits to medicaid enrollees and to provide outreach and eligibility services for individuals and families at federally qualified health centers. Appropriates funds from the community health centers special fund to establish health homes. Appropriates general revenues for administrative support for the health homes program. Appropriates funds to the department of health for direct health care for uninsured and underinsured patients at community health centers. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1071.title: Jurors; Jury Service; Exemptions; Advanced Practice Registered Nurse
1071.description: Enables self-employed advanced practice registered nurses to claim an exemption from jury service.

1072.title: Student Health and Safety; Anaphylaxis; Emergency Administration of Epinephrine
1072.description: Requires designated school personnel to be trained to administer epinephrine to a student believed to be having an anaphylactic emergency, with the written authorization of the student's parent or guardian. Requires schools to obtain a prescription and maintain a supply of epinephrine for anaphylactic emergencies.

1073.title: Tobacco Products; Excise Tax; Hawaii Cancer Research Special Fund
1073.description: Expands the definition of "tobacco products" to include any product containing nicotine, but not containing tobacco. Imposes an excise tax equal to 80 per cent of the wholesale price of any tobacco product, other than large cigars, sold by a wholesaler or dealer on and after January 1, 2016, whether or not sold at wholesale, or if not sold then at the same rate upon the use by the wholesaler or dealer. Requires any increase in the excise tax rate imposed on cigarettes or little cigars on or after 1/1/2016 to trigger an automatic excise tax increase on other tobacco products on or after 1/1/2016. Requires the additional moneys collected under the excise tax to be deposited to the credit of the Hawaii cancer research special fund.

1074.title: Crime Victim Compensation; Mandatory Fee
1074.description: Removes the provision allowing criminal courts to waive the crime victim compensation fee upon a finding that the defendant is unable to pay.

1075.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) San Buenaventura voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Ichiyama, C. Lee, McDermott, Ohno, Souki, Woodson excused (6).
1075.title: Family or Household Member Abuse; Body Parts; Abuse; Class C Felony
1075.description: Adds the mouth and nose of a family or household member to the types of body parts on which pressure that is applied to intentionally or knowingly impede normal breathing or blood circulation shall constitute abuse of a family or household member as a class C felony.

1076.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 610).
1076.title: Tax Credits; Capital Infrastructure; Honolulu Harbor
1076.description: Sets the maximum amount of capital infrastructure tax credits that may be issued in any taxable year at $2,500,000 per qualified infrastructure tenant. Allows any capital infrastructure costs that would result in a tax credit in excess of the maximum amount to be applied to subsequent tax years. Requires a qualified infrastructure tenant to expend $40,000,000 within a taxable year before becoming eligible for the tax credit. Recaptures the tax credit if the qualified infrastructure tenant fails to relocate within an unspecified amount of time following the execution of a lease with the department of transportation. Requires taxpayers claiming the tax credit to submit information to the legislature. Effective 7/1/2053. (SD2)

1077.title: Land Use Commission; Imposed Conditions on Land; Land Classification
1077.description: Provides the land use commission with greater enforcement flexibility in situations where conditions, necessary to be met for a property's land reclassification, are unmet by the petitioner.

1078.title: Board of Land and Natural Resources; Mineral Resources; Geothermal Resources
1078.description: Revises statutory provisions relating to the regulation of geothermal and mineral resources under chapters 171 and 182, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to provide clarity and consistency. (SD2)

1079.title: Road Maintenance; Disputed Roads; Counties
1079.description: Specifies that a government agency does not assume ownership or jurisdiction over a disputed road solely through maintenance activities. Authorizes State to quitclaim ownership of roads in favor of counties.

1080.title: Tax Credit; Research Activities
1080.description: Provides that, notwithstanding the provisions of the Internal Revenue Code to the contrary, the amount of the state tax credit for research activities shall be calculated based on all qualified research expenses for the taxable year instead of on the increase of expenses over past years. (HB1172 HD1)

1081.title: Public Agency Meetings, Government Records; Sunshine Law
1081.description: Amends the Sunshine Law to expressly allow certain government records to be shared among public board members where no commitment relating to a vote on the matter is made or sought.

1082.title: DOE; Athletics; Referees
1082.description: Requires the DOE to create a certification program for referees of high school athletic events.

1083.title: Irrigation; Irrigation System Revolving Fund; Income Tax Credit
1083.description: Establishes an income tax credit for farmers who purchase water at higher rates from county water boards rather than at lower state irrigation system rates. Establishes the amount of the credit as the difference between the amount charged by state irrigation systems and the amount the state irrigation systems should charge in order to sustain operations. Deducts the cost of the tax credit from the irrigation system revolving fund. Applies to taxable years beginning after 12/31/2015.

1084.last_action: Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 04-29-16 10:00AM in conference room 016.
1084.title: E-liquid; Electronic Smoking Devices; Packaging Requirements; Prohibitions; Penalties ($)
1084.description: Beginning January 1, 2017, prohibits the sale of an e-liquid container for an electronic smoking device unless the container is child-resistant and prohibits the sale of an e-liquid container that includes e-liquid containing nicotine unless the e-liquid packaging is labeled with warning language. Establishes a violation as a penalty. Includes e-liquid under the definition of "hazardous substance" as used in the Hawaii Poison Prevention Packaging Act. (SD1)

1085.title: DOA; Grant Writing Position; Appropriation ($)
1085.description: Appropriates moneys to establish a grant writer position within the DOA. Prioritizes organic and Korean natural farming. (SD1)

1086.title: CIP; 21st Representative District ($)
1086.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the 21st representative district.

1087.title: Income Tax; Inflation Adjustments; Report
1087.description: Provides for annual adjustments to the Hawaii standard deduction, income tax rate brackets, and personal exemption in response to increases in inflation as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor Consumer Price Index. Requires DOTAX to submit a report to the legislature evaluating the adjustments made by the Act. Sunsets 1/1/2020. (HB1179 HD1)

1088.title: Income Tax; Basic Standard Deduction; Personal Exemption
1088.description: Amends the state income tax law by changing the amounts of the basic standard deduction and personal exemption. (HB1181 HD1)

1089.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 610).
1089.title: Income Tax Credit; Expenses for Household and Dependent Care Services Necessary for Gainful Employment
1089.description: Amends the income tax credit for expenses for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment by changing the manner in which the taxpayer's applicable percentage is determined. (SD1)

1090.title: Campaign Spending Commission; Comprehensive Public Funding; Appropriation ($)
1090.description: Creates program for comprehensive public funding of candidates for the offices of state senator and representative. Repeals the eligibility of candidates for the offices of state senator and representative for public funds under the existing partial public financing program. Appropriates funds to the campaign spending commission to prepare for the comprehensive public funding program in 2016, including staff support. (HD1)

1091.title: Tobacco Regulation; License Fee; Retail Tobacco Permit; Cigarettes; Tobacco Products; Smoking Cessation Programs
1091.description: Expands the definition of "tobacco products". Increases the license fee for persons engaged as a wholesaler or dealer of cigarettes or tobacco products. Increases the retail tobacco permit fee for retailers engaged in the retail sale of cigarettes and other tobacco products. Specifies that revenue from the license and permit fees shall be used to support smoking cessation programs in the State.

1092.title: General Obligation Bonds; State Constitution (ConAm)
1092.description: Proposes to amend the State Constitution by requiring the first principal installment of general obligation bonds and reimbursable general obligation bonds to mature not later than one year from the date of issuance. (HB1185 HD1)

1093.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 610).
1093.title: Public Finance; General Obligation Bonds
1093.description: Authorizes the allocation of premiums from general obligation bonds for capital expenditures approved by the Legislature. Effective 7/1/2015. (SD1)

1094.title: Cigarette Tax and Tobacco Tax Law; Distribution Maximums
1094.description: Amends the cigarette tax and tobacco tax law by establishing maximum dollar amounts that shall be distributed among certain non-general funds. Retains provision that the general fund receive the remainder after distribution. (HB1187 HD1)

1095.title: Hawaii Tobacco Settlement; Funds
1095.description: Changes appropriations of money in the Hawaii tobacco settlement fund to set dollar amounts.

1096.title: Honor and Remember Flag
1096.description: Designates the Honor and Remember Flag as the State's emblem of service and sacrifice by the brave men and women of the United States Armed Forces who have given their lives in the line of duty.

1097.title: Short Form; Arts
1097.description: Short form bill relating to the arts.

1098.title: Short Form; Veterans
1098.description: Short form bill relating to veterans.

1099.title: Short Form; International Affairs
1099.description: Short form bill relating to international affairs.

1100.title: Short Form; Military
1100.description: Short form bill relating to the military.

1101.title: Agricultural Districts; Tourism; Commerce; County Regulation
1101.description: Repeals provision requiring counties to adopt ordinances regulating agricultural tourism as a precondition for allowing agricultural tourism activities in an agricultural district. Allows agricultural commerce, rather than agricultural tourism, in an agricultural district. (HB1194 HD1)

1102.title: Expanded Adult Residential Care Homes; Population
1102.description: Increases the capacity from two to three nursing facility level residents in Type I Expanded Adult Residential Care Homes. (SD1)

1103.title: DHS; Auditor; QExA
1103.description: Requires an audit of contracts with DHS to provide QUEST expanded access QExA managed care plans to cover eligible individuals who are aged, blind, or disabled with regard to late payments to health care providers.

1104.title: Appropriation; Department of Health ($)
1104.description: Appropriates funds to the department of health for securing thermal body scanners for screening potentially ill travelers.

1105.title: Honolulu Family Justice Center; Appropriation; Matching Funds ($)
1105.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of the Prosecuting Attorney of the City and County of Honolulu for the Honolulu Family Justice Center; provided that the City and County of Honolulu provides matching funds on a 1:1 basis. (SD1)

1106.title: Domestic Violence Policy; Law Enforcement Agencies
1106.description: Requires law enforcement agencies to adopt and implement a written policy on domestic violence committed or allegedly committed by agency law enforcement officers. Establishes standards, training deadlines, administrative procedures, and reporting requirements.

1107.title: Board of Education; Student Member; Voting
1107.description: Extends voting rights to a student member of the Board of Education.

1108.title: CIP; 5th Representative District ($)
1108.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 5th Representative District.

1109.title: Agricultural Lands; Dwelling Units; Housing Facilities
1109.description: Allows the fee or leasehold owner of agricultural district land to change rent or fee for dwelling accommodations on the property for various non-agricultural purposes. (HB1202 HD1)

1110.title: Marijuana; County Authorization to Legalize
1110.description: Authorizes the counties to adopt ordinances to legalize marijuana possession, sale, and use, for persons over the age of twenty-one. Clarifies that penal code provisions pertaining to drug and intoxicating compounds offenses do not apply to counties that have adopted ordinances legalizing marijuana and adopted administrative rules to regulate marijuana.

1111.title: Procurement; Sustainable Procurements Manager; Appropriation ($)
1111.description: Appropriates funds for a new position within the state procurement office tasked with facilitating the development and implementation of procurement processes for public agencies and private organizations for the purpose of food sustainability in Hawaii.

1112.title: Hawaii-grown Food Procurement Task Force; Procurement; Appropriation ($)
1112.description: Establishes and appropriates funds for the Hawaii-grown food procurement task force for the purpose of creating recommendations for increasing procurement of food grown in Hawaii by State departments and agencies.

1113.title: University of Hawaii Sustainability Office; Appropriation ($)
1113.description: Establishes the University of Hawaii sustainability office. Appropriates funds.

1114.title: Road Repair and Repaving; Appropriations; Counties; Grant-in-aid
1114.description: Appropriates state matching funds to the counties for road repair and repaving. Establishes additional requirements to qualify for the use of the state matching funds.

1115.title: Senior Farmers' Market Nutrition Program; Appropriation; Report
1115.description: Appropriates funds to the Senior Farmers' Market Nutrition Program. Requires DLIR to submit a report to the Legislature on the status of the program. (HB1208 HD1)
