2142.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates moneys for fiscal year 2016-2017 for the design and construction of a new state mental health hospital to replace the Hawaii State Hospital in Kaneohe. (HB2260 HD1)

2144.description: Appropriates funds for the continuation of the manufacturing grant program, within High Technology Development Corporation. (HB2262 HD1)

2145.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to conduct an economic assessment study on the development and economic viability of a small satellite launch and processing facility on the Island of Hawaii. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2146.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Thursday 04-28-16 2:30PM in conference room 423.
2146.title: High Technology Development Corporation; Internship Grants; Local Workforce Development; Appropriation ($)
2146.description: Makes an appropriation to the High Technology Development Corporation for the provision of technology internship grants and development of programs to support the local talent pipeline for the technology industry. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2148.last_action: The conference committee deferred the measure.
2148.title: Executive Office on Early Learning; Early Learning Advisory Board; Appropriations ($)
2148.description: Makes appropriations to the Executive Office on Early Learning for staffing and travel. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2149.description: Defines curricular materials to include both printed and digital material. Clarifies that moneys for curricular materials can be used for digital formats. (HB2267 CD1)

2150.last_action: Referred to VMI, FIN, referral sheet 3
2150.title: Indigenous Peoples' Day
2150.description: Re-designates the second Monday of October from "Discoverers' Day" to "Indigenous Peoples' Day".

2151.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2151.title: Education; National Board Certification Incentive Program
2151.description: Expands the National Board Certification Incentive Program to provide monetary incentives to school psychologists. Authorizes continuing bonuses for school psychologists in certain designated schools that improve and no longer carry a certain designation. Effective July 1, 2050. (SD1)

2152.last_action: The committee(s) on AGR recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2152.title: Invasive Species Authority; Establishment and Appropriation ($)
2152.description: Restructures the Hawaii Invasive Species Council as the Hawaii Invasive Species Authority, attached administratively to the Department of Agriculture, for the enhancement of the State's invasive species prevention, early detection, rapid response, control, enforcement, and outreach programs. Establishes the Hawaii Invasive Species Authority Special Fund and appropriates moneys to that fund to implement the Authority and relevant invasive species projects.

2153.last_action: The committee(s) on AGR recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

2153.description: Establishes a grant program within chapter 163D, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2154.last_action: Referred to AGR, FIN, referral sheet 4
2154.title: Biosecurity Program; Objectives; General Actions; and Program Charges
2154.description: Improves the effectiveness of Hawaii biosecurity program by establishing the program as a function of the whole department of agriculture. The improvement of Hawaii biosecurity goes beyond the confines of the plant quarantine branch and often also includes other groups both inside and outside of state government.

2155.last_action: Referred to WAL, JUD, referral sheet 4
2155.title: Hunting on Private Lands
2155.description: Requires hunters to obtain written permission from landowners or occupiers or holders of private lands to hunt on private lands. Effective July 1, 2016.

2156.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2156.title: Agricultural Loan Revolving Fund ($)
2156.description: Appropriates funds for the Agricultural Loan Revolving Fund to support the State's food sustainability goals. (HB2274 HD1)

2157.last_action: The committee(s) on AGR recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2157.title: Special Purpose Revenue Bonds; Big Island Dairy LLC ($)
2157.description: Authorizes the issuance of special purpose revenue bonds up to $10,000,000 to assist Big Island Dairy LLC for the planning, design, and construction of new milking facilities.

2158.last_action: Referred to PBS, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 4
2158.title: Prepaid Wireless; Enhanced 911 Services
2158.description: Establishes a prepaid wireless E911 surcharge of 66 cents per retail transaction of prepaid wireless telecommunications service at the point of sale. Allows sellers to deduct and retain 3 per cent of the surcharge that is collected. Requires the amounts collected by the Enhanced 911 Board to be placed in the Enhanced 911 Fund. Effective on July 1, 2017.

2159.last_action: Vetoed on 07/11/2016 - Returned from the Governor without approval (Gov. Msg. No. 1336).
2159.title: King Kamehameha Celebration Commission; DAGS
2159.description: Amends the membership, mission, and purpose of the King Kamehameha Celebration Commission. Authorizes the Chairperson to appoint an advisory committee for historical and archival matters. Authorizes the Commission to appoint an Executive Director. (HB2277 CD1)

2160.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Mizuno, Tokioka excused (2).
2160.title: Consolidation of the Office of Information Management and Technology and the Information and Communication Services Division
2160.description: Consolidates the Office of Information Management and Technology and the Information and Communication Services Division of the Department of Accounting and General Services, including all related information technology functions, in the Office of Enterprise Technology Services under the direction of the Chief Information Officer. The amendments are intended to create greater efficiency in state government and clarify roles and responsibilities in new governance processes by consolidating the two programs that already fall under the oversight of the Chief Information Officer. Effective 7/2/2112.

2161.title: Appropriations; Claims Against the State ($)
2161.description: Makes appropriations for claims against the State, its officers, and its employees. (HB2279 CD1)

2162.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).

2162.description: Defines "property" as used in section 28-5.2, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2163.title: Service of Process; Notice; Paternity Cases
2163.description: Amends the Uniform Parentage Act to allow for service by publication or by any other manner that is reasonably calculated to give the party actual notice of proceedings and an opportunity to be heard when respondents cannot be located or personally served. (SD1)

2164.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2164.title: Involuntary Termination of Parental Rights
2164.description: Provides that a parent's rights may be terminated if the court determines, by clear and convincing evidence, that the child was conceived during an act of rape or sexual assault creating a presumption that termination of parental rights is in the best interest of the child. (HB2282 HD1)

2166.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 652).
2166.title: Guardianship; Gun Control
2166.description: Requires the courts to provide information relating to adult guardianships to the Hawaii criminal justice data center to disclose to the Federal Bureau of Investigation National Instant Criminal Background Check System database for gun control purposes. Requires the Hawaii criminal justice data center to maintain the adult guardianship orders of appointment or information for disclosure to and use by law enforcement officials for firearm permitting or registration purposes. Takes effect on 1/1/2017. (SD1)

2167.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2167.title: Department of the Attorney General; Litigation Deposits Trust Fund
2167.description: Amends provisions relating to the deposit and use of moneys in the Litigation Deposits Trust Fund (Fund). Provides that recoveries from civil action or settlement of civil claims initiated or prosecuted by the Attorney General, and recoveries from false claims, shall be deposited into the Fund. Specifies that fifteen percent of any recovery, including false claims, shall be retained by the Fund. (HB2285 HD1)

2168.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) LoPresti voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Oshiro excused (2).
2168.title: Professionally Licensed Or Certified Government Employees; Privilege; Immunity
2168.description: Provides professionally licensed or certified government employees with the same privileges and immunities as other state employees. (HB2286 HD1)

2169.last_action: Referred to WAL, JUD, referral sheet 4
2169.title: Criminal Trespass
2169.description: Adds the offense of criminal trespass onto state lands to part II of chapter 708, Hawaii Revised Statutes, and amends criminal trespass in the second degree to include and apply to agricultural property owned by the government that is not fenced, enclosed or otherwise secured in a manner designed to exclude intruders.

2170.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Oshiro excused (2).
2170.title: Hawaii Strategic Development Corporation; HI Growth Initiative
2170.description: Allocates an unspecified amount of the Corporation Income Tax collected each year for five years to the Hawaii Strategic Development Corporation Revolving Fund for the HI Growth Initiative, an investment program to develop an ecosystem to support high-growth entrepreneurial companies in the State. (HB2288 HD1)

2171.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday, 04-29-16 at 5:45PM in Conference Room 423.
2171.title: Hawaii Community-Based Economic Development Technical and Financial Assistance Program; Appropriation ($)
2171.description: Amends the eligible uses of community-based economic development grants to include technical assistance. Amends grant eligibility criteria. Reduces the size of community-based economic development advisory council. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2172.last_action: Re-referred to EDB, FIN, referral sheet 14
2172.title: High Technology Development Corporation; Hawaii Technology Development Corporation
2172.description: Changes the name of the High Technology Development Corporation to Hawaii Technology Development Corporation. Effective July 1, 2050. (HB2090 HD1)

2173.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday 04-29-16 4:10PM in conference room 225.
2173.title: Geothermal Resources Exploration; Drilling; County Authority; Renewable Energy; Solar and Wind Energy Property; Tax Credit
2173.description: Replaces the current renewable energy technology systems tax credit with tax credits for solar energy property, wind energy property, and energy storage property. Applies to taxable years beginning after 12/31/2016. (SD1)

2174.last_action: Referred to WAL, JUD, referral sheet 4
2174.title: Land Use Commission
2174.description: Provides the Land Use Commission with the power to amend, revise, or modify a decision and order granting a district boundary amendment, or fine a petitioner, when there has been a finding by the Land Use Commission that a petitioner or its successors or assigns has not adhered to the conditions imposed by the commission.

2175.description: Enables the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to develop mixed-use developments in partnership with state and county departments and agencies. Eff. 7/1/2016. (SD1)

2177.title: Aerospace Advisory Committee; Membership; Chair
2177.description: Reduces the number of members on the Aerospace Advisory Committee from 15 to 13. Allows the members of the Aerospace Advisory Committee to elect their own committee chair from members appointed by the Governor to this body. (SD1)

2178.title: Pacific International Space Center for Exploration Systems
2178.description: Eliminates the ex-officio National Aeronautics and Space Administration representative from the Pacific International Space Center for Exploration Systems Board. (HB2296 HD1)

2179.last_action: Referred to EDB, FIN, referral sheet 4

2179.description: Amends Act 88, Session Laws of Hawaii 2006, to repeal the sunset date for the amendments made to section 235-17, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2180.title: Creative Media and Film Infrastructure Special Fund ($)
2180.description: Expands funding sources to support creative industries development within the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism. Removes all references to the Hawaii Television and Film Development Board. (HB2298 HD1)

2181.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Luke, Nakashima, Souki excused (3).
2181.title: Natural Energy Laboratory of Hawaii Authority; Enterprise Zone Incentives; Renewable Energy Technology
2181.description: Provides Enterprise Zone incentives for qualified renewable energy technology business activity on real property owned by the Natural Energy Laboratory of Hawaii Authority. Effective February 19, 2022. (HB2299 HD1)

2183.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2183.title: Hawaii Green Infrastructure Authority; Composition
2183.description: Amends the composition of the Hawaii Green Infrastructure Authority. (HB2301 HD2)

2184.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Thielen voting no (1) and none excused (0).
2184.title: Transit-oriented Development; interagency Council; Appropriation ($)
2184.description: Establishes the Hawaii Interagency Council for Transit-Oriented Development within the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to institutionalize intergovernmental and interagency coordination on transit-oriented development planning statewide. Appropriates funds. Effective July 1, 2050. (HB2302 HD1)

2185.last_action: Referred to HSG, WAL, FIN, referral sheet 4
2185.title: Conveyance Tax; Allocation of Taxes Paid Into the Rental Housing Revolving Fund
2185.description: Repeals the statutory cap on the disposition of conveyance taxes dedicated for deposit into the Rental Housing Revolving Fund for the financing of affordable rental housing development.

2186.last_action: Referred to HSG, FIN, referral sheet 4
2186.title: Low-Income Housing Tax Credits
2186.description: Increases funding for affordable rental housing development by making the State Low-Income Housing Tax Credit more valuable. Reduces State Tax Credit period from ten to five years.

2187.title: Dwelling Unit Revolving Fund; Regional State Infrastructure Improvement Subaccounts
2187.description: Authorizes the creation of Regional State Infrastructure Improvement Subaccounts within the Dwelling Unit Revolving Fund and the use of the Dwelling Unit Revolving Fund to provide loans and grants to finance regional state infrastructure improvements in areas of planned growth. (HB2305 CD1)

2193.title: Vital Records; Reporting Deaths to State Agencies
2193.description: Authorizes the Department of Health to continue to disclose, including through electronic means, lists of names of persons whose deaths have been recorded by DOH, to state agencies that maintain official lists of persons and are prohibited by federal law from sharing information for the lists. Requires lists of the deceased from DOH to also include the last four digits of the deceased's social security number, if known. (SD1)

2194.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Oshiro excused (2).
2194.title: Employees' Retirement System; Employer Retirement Contributions
2194.description: Confirms that employer contributions to the Employees' Retirement System may be made in advance or on a monthly basis.

2195.title: Employees' Retirement System; Unclaimed Property
2195.description: Preserves the Employees' Retirement System's use and control of unclaimed member contributions and benefit payments. (HB2313 HD1)

2197.title: Disposition of Excess Revenues ($)
2197.description: To re-appropriate $10,000,000 in general funds to the Emergency and Budget Reserve Fund for fiscal year 2015-2016.

2198.title: Appropriations; repay general fund cash advances; Kapalama Military Reservation; Hawaii Health Systems Corporation ($)
2198.description: Makes general fund appropriations for fiscal year 20162017 to repay prior general fund cash advances of $89,900,000 for the purchase of lands of the former Kapalama Military Reservation and of $13,300,000 for the Hawaii Health Systems Corporation.

2199.title: Appropriation; Emergency and Budget Reserve Fund ($)
2199.description: Makes a general fund appropriation for fiscal year 20162017 to further capitalize the Emergency and Budget Reserve Fund. (HB2317 CD1)

2200.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 4
2200.title: Employees' Retirement System; Qualified Domestic Relations Order ($)
2200.description: Authorizes and requires the Employees' Retirement System to make direct payment to a spouse or former spouse of a system member or retirant of all or a portion of the member's or retirant's retirement benefits pursuant to a "qualified domestic relations order."

2201.title: Money Transmitters; Change in Control; Division of Financial Institutions; Criminal History Record Check
2201.description: Amends requirements under the money transmitters law for money transmitter licensee change in control applications, including requiring a criminal history record check on persons who will assume control of the licensee. Updates a reference to federal Regulation E. (SD1)

2202.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2202.title: Escrow Depositories; Division of Financial Institutions; Chapter 449D; Chapter 846; Change In Control; Controlling Person; NMLS; Principal; Transfer or Sale; Fee; Criminal Background Check
2202.description: Clarifies chapter 449, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by adding definitions and change in control requirements. Identifies previously authorized fees for initial license issuance; adds a nominal fee for license reissuance upon licensee name change; moves fee for application for proposed change in control to fee section. Authorizes the commissioner to implement use of NMLS, and changes license renewal date from July 1 to December 31 to conform to NMLS. Adds criminal background check and disclosure requirements to licensure and change in control applications, and amends section 846-2.7, Hawaii Revised Statutes, accordingly.

2203.last_action: Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 4
2203.title: Mortgage Loan Originators; Mortgage Servicers; Division of Financial Institutions; Chapter 454F; Chapter 454M; Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act
2203.description: Clarifies chapter 454F, Hawaii Revised Statutes, requirements for mortgage loan originators, and chapter 454M, requirements for mortgage servicers. Amends various definitions, including the definition of "residential mortgage loan". Moves mortgage servicer provisions that appear in chapter 454F, to chapter 454M, including a fee for a name or address change, that will apply to all mortgage servicers. Abolishes the mortgage loan servicer loan modification license under chapter 454F. Updates references to federal regulations.

2204.title: Property Insurance; Hawaii Property Insurance Association; Policies; Non-renewal; Lava Zone; State of Emergency; Moratorium
2204.description: Requires the Insurance Commissioner to determine whether residential property insurance is unavailable due to a moratorium on insurance policies in a lava zone during a state of emergency due to lava flow.

2205.last_action: Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 4
2205.title: The Insurance Holding Company System
2205.description: Adopts revisions to the National Association of Insurance Commissioners' model law on the Insurance Holding Company System Regulatory Act.

2206.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2206.title: Risk Management and Own Risk and Solvency Assessment Act; Model Risk Retention Act; Captives; Insurance
2206.description: Adopts the National Association of Insurance Commissioners' ("NAIC") Risk Management and Own Risk and Solvency Assessment Act; applies risk based capital supplemental provisions, severability, and notices provisions to risk retention captive insurance companies; adopts NAIC Model Risk Retention Act. (HB2324 HD1)

2207.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2207.title: Hawaii Mandatory Catastrophe Reserve Act; Catastrophe Insurance; Property Insurance; Premium Tax; Electronic Filing; Electronic Payments; Physician Assistant-delivered Services; Child Health Supervision; Accident and Health or Sickness; Claim Filer; Risk Retention; Captives; Mental Illness; Licensed Dietitians; Duty to Respond; Visual or Optometric Services Coverage; Licensed Physicians and Optome
2207.description: Makes various updates to title 24, Hawaii Revised Statutes, including: requiring property insurers to establish catastrophe reserve funds; requiring an insurer seeking to discontinue writing property coverage to file an affidavit; requiring the Insurance Commissioner's authorization for insurers providing residential property coverage; requiring insurers to file their premium tax statements electronically and to pay electronically; applying consumer protections to short-term health policies with preexisting conditions provisions; including physician assistant-delivered services under coverage for child health supervision for accident and health or sickness policies and for mutual benefit societies; requiring an entity to notify a claim filer under certain conditions; prohibiting a risk retention group from being a sponsor of and allowing it to be a participant in a sponsored captive insurance company; providing mental illness benefits coverage to licensed dietitians; requiring an entity's duty to respond to the Insurance Commissioner during an investigation or examination; providing visual or optometric services coverage for licensed physicians and optometrists and surgical or emergency services coverage for dentists under health plans of mutual benefit societies; providing coverage for pharmacist-delivered contraceptive services; and making other housekeeping and conforming amendments.

2208.title: Mortgage Rescue Fraud Prevention Act; Mortgage Rescue Fraud; Mortgage Assistance Relief Services; Distressed Property Owners
2208.description: Makes numerous amendments to Hawaii's mortgage rescue fraud prevention act, chapter 480E, Hawaii Revised Statutes, for consistency with the federal Mortgage Assistance Relief Services Rule. (SD1)

2209.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDL.
2209.title: Office of Consumer Protection; Service of Process; Subpoena; Investigators
2209.description: Clarifies scope of Office of Consumer Protection investigator powers.

2210.last_action: Referred to TRN, CPC, referral sheet 4
2210.title: Towing; Vehicle Owner; Hooked Up; Scene; Towing Company; Unfair or Deceptive Act or Practice
2210.description: Defines "vehicle owner", "scene", and "hooked up" for the purposes of towing unattended vehicles. Makes clarifying amendments. Specifies that violations of the section shall be per se violations of section 480-2, Hawaii Revised Statutes, and repeals prior fine provisions.

2211.title: Cause of Action; Limitation of Action; Consumer Protection
2211.description: Clarifies that the statute of limitations governing it does not apply to the State and its agencies with respect to chapter 480, Hawaii Revised Statutes. Repeals subsection (b) of section 48024, Hawaii Revised Statutes. Technical amendments.

2212.last_action: Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 4
2212.title: Public Utilities Commission; Special Fund; General Fund
2212.description: Amends the Public Utilities Commission Special Fund law to increase from $1,000,000 to $3,000,000 the balance that may be retained in the Public Utilities Commission Special Fund at the end of each fiscal year.

2213.title: Board of Nursing; Board of Speech Pathology and Audiology; Board Member Terms
2213.description: Amends the length of terms from three years to four years of the members of the Board of Nursing and the Board of Speech Pathology and Audiology. (HB2331 HD1)

2214.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with Representative(s) Tupola voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott, Ward voting no (2) and none excused (0).
2214.title: Repeal; Joint Formulary Advisory Committee
2214.description: Repeals the Joint Formulary Advisory Committee established under chapter 457, Hawaii Revised Statutes, and allows the Board of Nursing to determine the exclusionary formulary for qualified advanced practice registered nurses with prescriptive authority.

2215.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2215.title: Nursing; Nursys; Licensure; Identifying Information
2215.description: Allows the Board of Nursing to more fully participate in Nursys, a national database for nurse licensees by sharing license and disciplinary action information.

2216.last_action: Referred to CPC, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 4
2216.title: Citations; Massage Therapy Violations; Fines
2216.description: Authorizes the issuance of a citation for specific violations of massage therapy laws by licensees. Sets forth a process for licensees to contest the citation and provides for the assessment of fines for each violation.

2217.last_action: Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 611).
2217.title: Physician Discipline; Conditions; Hawaii Medical Board; Reciprocal Discipline
2217.description: Authorizes the Hawaii Medical Board to impose the same disciplinary action against a licensee as was taken by another state or federal agency. Establishes conditions for the disciplinary action. Prohibits the licensee from practicing until a final order of discipline is issued if the licensee has been prohibited from practicing in another state. (SD1)

2218.last_action: Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 4
2218.title: Real Estate Education Fund; Real Estate
2218.description: Removes the ambiguity caused by the mandatory and discretionary language; allows the continuity of Real Estate Education Fund operations; brings the Real Estate Education Fund in line with other operational funds within the Professional and Vocational Licensing Division of the Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs; allows the Real Estate Education Fund's budget scrutiny to occur through the rulemaking process.

2220.last_action: Referred to EDN, FIN, referral sheet 4
2220.title: Department of Education; Teachers; Educational Officers; Salary Increases; Step Increases
2220.description: Repeals annual increment and step salary increases for Department of Education teachers and educational officers.

2221.last_action: The committee(s) on OMH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2221.title: Hawaiian Home Lands; lease successors
2221.description: Lowers the required blood quantum to one-thirty second Hawaiian for the lessee's relatives currently eligible to succeed to a lease with one-thirty second Hawaiian including a lessee's husband, wife, children, grandchildren, brothers or sisters.

2222.title: Child Protective Act; Criminal History Record Checks
2222.description: Amends the Child Protective Act so that when an assessment is required, the Department of Human Services is authorized to conduct criminal history record checks, without consent, of an alleged perpetrator of harm or threat of harm and all adult household members living in the family home with the alleged victim child. (HB2340 CD1)

2223.last_action: Referred to HLT/HUS, FIN, referral sheet 4
2223.title: Hospital Sustainability Program; Hospital Sustainability Program Special Fund; Appropriation ($)
2223.description: Continues the Hospital Sustainability Program for one year. Appropriates funds out of the Hospital Sustainability Program Special Fund for fiscal year 2016-2017.

2224.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2224.title: Nursing Facility Sustainability Program; Appropriation ($)
2224.description: Continues the Nursing Facility Sustainability Program for one year. Appropriates funds out of the Nursing Facility Sustainability Program Special Fund for fiscal year 2016-2017. (HB2342 HD1)

2225.title: Child Care Providers; Background Checks; Health and Safety
2225.description: Brings state law into alignment with changes to the federal Child Care and Development Block Grant, P.L. 113-186. Requires DHS to conduct background checks, including sex offender registry checks, on household members and all employees of child care facilities and providers that are licensed or registered by or receive subsidies from the State, to set health and safety standards, and enforce requirements. (HB2343 CD1)

2226.last_action: The committee on JDL deferred the measure.
2226.title: Orders For Immediate Protection
2226.description: Amends section 346-231, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to address inconsistencies in statutory requirements regarding orders for immediate protection by allowing the Department of Human Services discretion on when to seek an order for immediate protection of a vulnerable adult. (HB2344 HD2)

2227.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2227.title: Certified Nurse Aides
2227.description: Repeals section 346-47 and amends sections 457A-1.5, 457A-2, and 457A-3, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to delete references to the Department of Human Services as licensing or certifying health care settings; and deletes references to the Department of Human Services investigating and disciplining certified nurse aides employed in health care settings.

2228.last_action: Referred to HSG, LAB, FIN, referral sheet 4
2228.title: Tenant Hire Program; Hawaii Public Housing Authority
2228.description: Expands the civil service exemption for employees hired under the tenant hire program by the Hawaii Public Housing Authority by removing the percentage limit on such hires.

2229.last_action: Referred to WAL/OMH, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 4
2229.title: Public Lands; Hawaii Public Housing Authority Exemption
2229.description: Exempts Hawaii Public Housing Authority lands from the definition of "public lands" in section 171-2, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2230.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2230.title: Department of Human Services; Management Positions; Civil Service Exemptions; Appropriation ($)
2230.description: Restores the permanently exempt second deputy director position within the Department of Human Services. Establishes secretary, community/project development director, and policy director positions. Exempts the community/project development director and policy director from civil service status. Appropriates funds for the newly established positions. Effective 7/1/2060. (SD1)

2231.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2231.title: Youth Transitioning From Foster Care
2231.description: Extends the application deadline for financial assistance for higher education available to foster or former foster youth, clarifies that financial assistance is for related higher education costs, and clarifies eligibility and program requirements of the Young Adult Voluntary Foster Care Program.

2232.title: Foster Children
2232.description: Updates the wording from "foster boarding home" to "resource family home" and "foster parent" to "resource caregiver"; establishes qualified immunity for resource caregivers and child caring institutions adhering to the reasonable and prudent parent standard; adds the requirement that resource caregivers and child care institutions use the reasonable and prudent parent standard when authorizing children in foster care to participate in activities; and changes the age from sixteen to fourteen years of age for children in foster care to be informed of services to transition from foster care to independent living. (HB2350 CD1)

2233.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Luke, Nakashima, Souki excused (3).
2233.title: Civil Service; Establish Positions ($)
2233.description: Authorizes establishment of civil service positions and appropriates associated general and non-general funds to enable Executive Branch departments to provide services to the public with civil service employees rather than through contracting. (HB2351 HD1)

2234.last_action: Referred to LAB, EDN, FIN, referral sheet 4
2234.title: Charter Schools; Workers' Compensation
2234.description: Requires charter schools to administer and pay charter schools workers' compensation claims, and secure necessary funding to support payment for charter schools workers' compensation liabilities under one of the several options allowed by the Hawaii workers' compensation law, including self-insurance. Effective July 1, 2016.

2235.title: Position Exemptions; Civil Service
2235.description: Makes various positions within the state energy office exempt from civil service. For a period of three years, authorizes the department of health to establish 18 exempt forensic psychologist positions and 2 exempt Hawaii state hospital primary care physician positions. For a period of three years, provides a civil service exemption for various positions in the department of human services, department of public safety, and the department of health. (HB2353 CD1)

2237.last_action: Referred to HLT, CPC/JUD, FIN, referral sheet 4
2237.title: Opioid Antagonist; Naloxone Hydrochloride; Opioid Overdose; Prevention; Emergency Response; Medical Immunity
2237.description: Creates immunity for individuals who prescribe, possess, or administer an opioid antagonist such as naloxone hydrochloride during an opioid-related drug overdose. Authorizes emergency personnel/first responders to administer naloxone hydrochloride. Requires Medicaid coverage for naloxone hydrochloride. Exempts pharmacists and pharmacies from licensure and permitting requirements, except for drug storage requirements, for storing and distributing opioid antagonists. Allows pharmacists to dispense naloxone hydrochloride without a prescription.

2238.title: Birth Defects Program
2238.description: Amends provisions relating to the use of collected information related to birth defects studies. (HB2356 HD1)

2239.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) DeCoite, Har, Jordan, Oshiro, Pouha, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Matsumoto, McDermott, Thielen, Tupola voting no (4) and Representative(s) Luke, Nakashima, Souki excused (3).
2239.title: Mental Health Services; Age of Consent
2239.description: Authorizes a minor who is fourteen years of age or older to consent to mental health treatment or counseling services by a licensed mental health professional if the professional deems the minor is mature enough to participate intelligently in the treatment or services. (HB2357 HD1)

2240.last_action: Re-referred to HUS, FIN, referral sheet 13
2240.title: Developmental Disabilities
2240.description: Amends the definition of "developmental disabilities" in section 333F-1, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to include children from birth to age nine who have substantial developmental delay or specific congenital or acquired condition and without services and supports, has a high probability of meeting criteria for developmental disabilities later in life. (HB2358 HD1)

2241.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2241.title: Forensic Mental Health; Procedures
2241.description: Ensures the timely administration of mental health examinations; supports the process of expedient administration of justice; and clarifies the procedure for reevaluation of fitness to proceed after a finding of unfitness and attempts at restoration. (HB2359 HD1)

2242.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2242.title: Hawaii Healthcare Workforce Advisory Board; Department of Labor and Industrial Relations
2242.description: Specifies that the nursing member on the Hawaii Healthcare Workforce Advisory Board (Board) is the Director of the Hawaii State Center for Nursing and that the Hawaii/Pacific Basin Education Center member is the director of the University of Hawaii John A. Burns School of Medicine. Provides that all members of the Board are entitled to reimbursement for necessary expenses incurred in the performance of their duties. (HB2360 HD1)

2243.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2243.title: Appropriation; Premium Supplementation Trust Fund ($)
2243.description: Makes an appropriation to replenish funds in the Premium Supplementation Trust Fund to cover the costs of health care expenses for eligible employees and for premium supplementation for employers that are entitled to premium supplementation under the Prepaid Health Care Law.

2244.title: Workforce Development Council; Composition; Duties
2244.description: Conforms the State Workforce Development Council Law to new federal requirements in the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act of 2014, which supersedes the Workforce Investment Act of 1998. (HB2362 CD1)

2245.title: Temporary Disability Insurance Exclusions; Workers' Compensation Penalties
2245.description: Excludes employers under certain circumstances from providing Temporary Disability Insurance (TDI) coverage for themselves if they perform services for their own corporation, limited liability company (LLC), limited liability partnership (LLP), partnership, or sole proprietorship. Allows the Director of Labor and Industrial Relations to receive electronic reports of injuries and other Workers' Compensation required reports. Increases the penalties for not having TDI coverage, for failure to make correct or timely benefit payments, for terminating such benefits, for failure to file medical reports, for employer's failure to provide copies of requested medical reports, for not having Workers' Compensation coverage, and for the deduction of premium payment from employee wages. (HB2363 CD1)

2246.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2246.title: Workers' Compensation; Compromise
2246.description: Amend the repeal date for the provision in 386-78(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes, that provides that compromises for workers' compensation claims reached as a result of a third-party liability claim or action do not require the approval of the Director of Labor and Industrial Relations. Repealed June 30, 2017.

2247.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Tokioka excused (1).
2247.title: Hawaii Health Insurance Programs; Department of Labor and Industrial Relations, Department of Human Services; Appropriations ($)
2247.description: Establishes the Hawaii State Health Insurance Programs. Requires the Department of Human Services to develop and administer outreach as required by the Affordable Care Act. Establishes the Affordable Care Act Legislative Oversight Committee. Repeals the Hawaii Health Insurance Exchange Law. Appropriates funds to the Department of Labor and Industrial Relations and the Department of Human Services. Requires the submittal of a report to the Legislature on the status of the Hawaii Health Insurance Programs prior to the 2018 Regular Session. (HB2365 HD1)

2249.last_action: The committee on JDL deferred the measure.
2249.title: Hawaii Employment Relations Act; Prevention of Unfair Labor Practices
2249.description: Allows the Hawaii Labor Relations Board the option of serving complaints and notices of hearings via first class mail and by electronic means. (HB2367 HD1)

2250.last_action: The committee(s) on LAB recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2250.title: Department of Labor and Industrial Relations; Recordkeeping; Insurance Plans
2250.description: Requires employers to keep a record of the physical addresses of the employer and the North American Industry Classification System code applicable to the employer; deletes anachronistic provision pertaining to insurance plan information. Takes effect on July 1, 2016.

2251.last_action: Re-referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 18
2251.title: Emergency Appropriation; Department of Labor and Industrial Relations; Department of Human Services ($)
2251.description: Makes an emergency appropriation for fiscal year 2015-2016 for the Department of Labor and Industrial Relations and the Department of Human Services to cover short-term costs required to comply with the Affordable Care Act.

2252.last_action: Referred to LAB, HLT, FIN, referral sheet 4
2252.title: Affordable Care Act Waiver; Authorization
2252.description: Authorizes the Governor to submit and implement a waiver from certain provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act of 2010.

2253.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2253.title: State Boating Facilities; Disposition
2253.description: Clarifies that the Board of Land and Natural Resources may lease all fast lands and submerged lands within any existing state boating facility without prior authorization of the Legislature by concurrent resolution pursuant to section 171-53, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2254.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2254.title: Commercial Activity; Ocean Recreation and Coastal Area Programs
2254.description: Clarifies the definition of commercial activity for purposes of DLNR regulation of ocean and coastal recreation activities. Specifies that land-based retail, rental, and activity providers are not subject to DLNR regulation. (HB2372 HD2)

2255.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott voting no (1) and Representative(s) Creagan, San Buenaventura, Say excused (3).
2255.title: Liveaboard Fees; State Small Boat Harbors
2255.description: Amends the current rate of the liveaboard fee for state small boat harbors and clarifies that the liveaboard fee may be increased or decreased by rule adopted by the Department of Land and Natural Resources pursuant to chapter 91, Hawaii Revised Statutes. (HB2373 HD1)

2256.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Lowen, Tupola voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott voting no (1) and Representative(s) Creagan, San Buenaventura, Say excused (3).
2256.title: Mooring Permits; Transfer
2256.description: Allows a holder of a mooring permit within state small boat harbors to transfer the mooring permit to a new vessel owner under certain terms and conditions. Establishes a Mooring Permit Task Force to examine issues regarding the transfer of state small boat harbor permits. (HD2374 HD1)

2257.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2257.title: Aquatic Mitigation Bank
2257.description: Authorizes the Department of Land and Natural Resources to establish and operate aquatic mitigation banks to restore, create, enhance, or preserve aquatic habitats or resources as compensatory mitigation.

2258.last_action: Referred to EEP/WAL, JUD, referral sheet 4
2258.title: Predator Control
2258.description: Increases protection to human health and wildlife by prohibiting individuals from releasing, feeding, watering, or otherwise caring for unrestrained predators on state lands and provides a fine for individuals that violate this prohibition and an exemption for hunters who deploy, feed, or water unrestrained dogs in the course of hunting.

2259.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2259.title: Threatened and Endangered Species
2259.description: Extends the sunset date on the use of new safe harbor agreements, habitat conservation plans, and incidental take licenses as recovery options for conserving and protecting the State's threatened and endangered species to July 1, 2020. (HB2377 HD1)

2260.title: Penalties; Chapter 183; Repeal; Section 183-4
2260.description: Allows the Board to set, charge, and collect fines for violations of section 183-17, Hawaii Revised Statutes. Clarifies that any person violating any provision of part II of chapter 183, Hawaii Revised Statutes, or any rule adopted pursuant thereto shall be guilty of a petty misdemeanor, except for any violation of section 183-17, Hawaii Revised Statutes, that shall be a misdemeanor. Repeals section 183-4, Hawaii Revised Statutes. (HB2378 HD2)

2261.last_action: The committee(s) on OMH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2261.title: State Ocean Waters; Commercial Use
2261.description: Authorizes the Department of Land and Natural Resources to limit commercial use of state ocean waters where it is reasonable for environmental or user safety considerations to do so.

2262.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Thursday 02-04-16 8:30AM in conference room 329.
2262.title: After-school Programs; Resources for Enrichment, Athletics, Culture, and Health Program.
2262.description: Establishes the R.E.A.C.H. (Resources for Enrichment, Athletics, Culture, and Health) program in the Office of Youth Services to provide a standardized framework and a funding mechanism for after-school programs in public middle schools. Requires the Office of Youth Services to report to the Legislature.

2263.last_action: Referred to CPC, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 4
2263.title: Commissioners of Deeds; Rules; Fees; Administrative Fines; Office of the Lieutenant Governor; Appropriation ($)
2263.description: Clarifies the Lieutenant Governor's rulemaking authority; authorizes the Lieutenant Governor to assess and collect fees and administrative fines; clarifies that the Lieutenant Governor is responsible for the commissioners of deeds program; increases the surety bond requirement from $1,000 to $10,000; and makes appropriations. Effective July 1, 2016.

2264.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Luke, Nakashima, Souki excused (3).
2264.title: Pacific-Asia Institute for Resilience and Sustainability
2264.description: Amends Act 229, Session Laws of Hawaii 2014, to make the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism the State's liaison to the Pacific-Asia Institute for Resilience and Sustainability. (HB2382 HD1)

2265.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2265.title: Statewide Integrated Sex Offender Treatment Program
2265.description: Amends chapter 353E, Hawaii Revised Statutes (HRS), to reflect nationally recognized best practices in the statewide, integrated programming for sex offenders, and to identify the coordinating body for the sex offender treatment program as the "sex offender management team." Exempts the statewide integrated sex offender treatment program from the requirements of chapter 92, HRS.

2266.last_action: Referred to PBS, JUD, referral sheet 4
2266.title: Parole; Legislative Appropriations; Discharged Persons
2266.description: Specifies that funds for discharged persons be subject to legislative appropriation. Clarifies circumstances under which the Hawaii Paroling Authority may grant early discharges. Provides discretion to the paroling authority with respect to initial pardon consideration as it relates to paroled prisoners.

2267.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2267.title: Correctional Facilities; Court Orders to Provide Medical Treatment
2267.description: Allows for a declaration to be filed with the petition as an alternative to an affidavit; expands the court's ability to continue the hearing on the petition for good cause; gives the court more flexibility in deciding when a guardian ad litem is necessary; changes the time requirement for filing for a court order for medical treatment from a period of within two days of an examination of the person to within five days; redefines the persons who must be notified of the petition; clarifies the effective expiration date of the order for persons who return to custody after release; and provides the ability for the department to seek an extension of an order to treat if necessary.

2271.title: Federal Reimbursement Maximization Special Fund
2271.description: Allows use of the Federal Reimbursement Maximization Special Fund to recruit and maintain corrections workforce. (HB2389 CD1)

2272.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2272.title: Employment Practices
2272.description: Adds the Department of Public Safety to the exceptions for the use of lie detector tests and psychological tests.

2273.title: Early Release of Certain Misdemeanants
2273.description: Defines circumstances under which the Director of Public Safety may release certain misdemeanants from community correctional centers. Requires the Director of Public Safety to submit a report to the Legislature regarding certain information regarding the early release of certain incarcerated misdemeanants. Applies only to persons charged with offenses subject to sentencing in section 706-663, Hawaii Revised Statutes, on or after the effective date of this measure. Sunsets on 7/1/2020. (HB2391 CD1)

2274.title: Conformity to the Internal Revenue Code for 2015; Income Tax; Estate and Generation-skipping Transfer Tax
2274.description: Conforms Hawaii income and estate and generation-skipping transfer tax laws to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended as of December 31, 2015, and makes technical, nonsubstantive amendments.

2275.title: Tax Review Commission ($)
2275.description: Provides a measure for extending the reporting date of the 2015-2017 tax review commission and appropriates $250,000 for fiscal year 2016-2017 for the commission.

2276.title: Tax Administration
2276.description: Imposes interest on unpaid penalties and fines; requires filing with tax appeal court a notice of transfer upon transfer of appeal to tax appeal court; amends rate of interest on amounts paid out of litigated claims fund; and requires full payment of assessed taxes, penalties, and interest for the first appeal where the assessment exceeds $50,000.

2277.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) DeCoite, Ichiyama, Jordan, Kawakami, McKelvey, Morikawa, San Buenaventura, Tupola voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Choy, Har, Oshiro, Ward voting no (4) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2277.title: Taxation; Disclosure of Tax Return Information
2277.description: Amends section 231-18, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to allow disclosure of tax return information to the Department of the Attorney General, federal, state, or local officials, and other persons in specified situations; and amends section 235-116, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to clarify that all information filed under chapter 235, Hawaii Revised Statutes, with any state agency is confidential.

2278.title: Taxes; Income Tax Refunds
2278.description: Specifies that taxpayers who file an amended return under section 235-101, Hawaii Revised Statutes, may not claim a refund unless such refund is claimed within the time limits established by section 235-111, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2279.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2279.title: Tax Administration; Administrative Tax Appeals and Dispute Resolution Program
2279.description: Amends section 231-7.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to clarify the types of cases that can be appealed, clarify certain procedures, and make other technical, nonsubstantive changes.

2280.title: Taxes; General Excise Tax Licensing
2280.description: Requires that any license issued under section 237-9, Hawaii Revised Statutes, be renewed annually; permits the department to charge a fee for annual renewals; and permits the department to require annual renewals be applied for online.

2281.last_action: The committee(s) on EDB recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2281.title: Taxes; Special Event Reporting
2281.description: Requires operators of special events to file reports giving information about the vendors participating in special events. Grants Department of Taxation authority to issue citations for failure to file report.

2282.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
2282.title: Cigarette Tax and Tobacco Tax; Legal Notice on Cigarette Shipping Containers
2282.description: Amends the legal notice required on cigarette shipping containers to reference the age of twenty-one rather than the age of eighteen.

2285.title: Medical Advisory Board; Composition
2285.description: Amends the composition of the medical advisory board. (SD1)

2286.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2286.title: Kona International Airport at Keahole; Inspection ($)
2286.description: Appropriates funds for a federal inspection station at Kona International Airport at Keahole. (HB2404 HD1)

2287.last_action: Referred to TRN, FIN, referral sheet 4
2287.title: Driver License Renewal
2287.description: Ensures driver license procedures are compliant with the Real ID Act.

2288.last_action: Re-referred to TRN, CPC/JUD, FIN, referral sheet 7
2288.title: Highway; Safety; Motor Vehicle
2288.description: Amends the law relating to the storage of opened container that contains intoxicating liquor or the consumption at the scenic lookout. Clarifies where intoxicating liquor may be kept in a motor vehicle. Further clarifies who and where an opened container may be possessed in a recreational vehicle, house coach, or house trailer.

2289.title: Disposition of Land; Airport-related and Maritime-related Operations
2289.description: Clarifies the statute that authorizes the Department of Transportation to negotiate disposition of lands under its control for aeronautical, airport-related, maritime, and maritime-related operations. (HB2407 HD2)

2290.title: Disposition of Land; Department of Transportation
2290.description: Authorizes the Department of Transportation to issue revocable permits without approval of the Board of Land and Natural Resources. Effective July 1, 2050. Repealed on July 1, 2021. (HB2408 HD2)

2291.last_action: Referred to TRN, FIN, referral sheet 4
2291.title: Transportation; Liquid Fuel Tax; Motor Vehicle; Registration; Weight Tax; State Highway Fund; Operations; Maintenance ($)
2291.description: Increases the State Fuel Tax to generate additional revenues for the State Highway Fund by amending section 243-4, Hawaii Revised Statutes. Allows for increase in the state motor vehicle registration fee and deposits the money into the State Highway Fund by amending section 249-31, Hawaii Revised Statutes. Increases the state motor vehicle weight tax and deposits the money into the State Highway Fund by amending section 249-33, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2293.last_action: The committee(s) on HED recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2293.title: State Ethics Code; University of Hawaii; Technology Transfer Activities
2293.description: Clarifies that certain sections of the State Ethics Code shall not apply to technology transfer activities. Requires such activities to comply with the regulatory framework and research compliance program approved by the Board of Regents. Requires written status report to the Legislature every two years.

2295.last_action: Referred to HED, FIN, referral sheet 4
2295.title: University of Hawaii; Authorization of Revenue Bonds ($)
2295.description: Authorizes the University of Hawaii to issue $100,000,000 in revenue bonds for the purpose of financing the construction and maintenance of qualifying capital improvement projects.

2296.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Luke, Nakashima, Souki excused (3).
2296.title: University of Hawaii; Hawaii Innovation Initiative ($)
2296.description: Provides express legal authority to enable the University of Hawaii to create, promote, and participate in new economic enterprises that use university research and provide workforce opportunities for affiliated university personnel. (HB2414 HD1)

2297.title: Non-general Funds; Repeal; Reclassify; Transfer of Balances
2297.description: Repeals the Kapolei recreational sports complex special fund, reclassifies the prepaid airport use charge fund to a trust fund, and abolishes the photo enforcement revolving fund. Transfers the remaining unencumbered balances to the general fund. (SD1)

2298.title: Renewable Energy Facility Siting Process; Repeal
2298.description: Repeals chapter 201N, HRS, relating to the REFSP. Deposits proceeds in the renewable energy facility siting special fund into the general fund.

2299.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Tokioka excused (1).
2299.title: Hawaii Interagency Council on Homelessness; Membership
2299.description: Adds the Chair of the Board of Land and Natural Resources and Director of Transportation as members of the Hawaii Interagency Council on Homelessness.

2300.last_action: Referred to OMH/TRN, FIN, referral sheet 5
2300.title: Transportation; Intra-Island Water Ferry Transportation System; Leeward Coast; Oahu
2300.description: Authorizes the department of transportation to implement an intra-island water ferry transportation system along the leeward coast of Oahu with one ferry landing originating from the Waianae Small Boat Harbor.

2301.last_action: Referred to OMH, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2301.title: Department of Hawaiian Homes Lands; Independent Counsel
2301.description: Authorizes the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands to employ or retain independent counsel.

2302.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Mizuno, Tokioka excused (2).
2302.title: Hawaii Association of Conservation Districts; Appropriation ($)
2302.description: Appropriates moneys for the Hawaii Association of Conservation Districts to assist with its staffing and operating costs. (HB2420 HD1)

2303.last_action: Referred to WAL/AGR, FIN, referral sheet 5
2303.title: Hawaiian Coot, Moorhen, Nene Goose, Stilt, and Duck; Agricultural Interaction; Research; Report; Appropriation ($)
2303.description: Requires the Department of Land and Natural Resources to research the interaction of the Hawaiian coot, moorhen, nene goose, stilt, and duck with agricultural practices and publish an annual report in a format that assists the agricultural industry in economically and environmentally interacting with the specified species. Appropriates funds.

2304.title: Liquor License; Liquor Commission
2304.description: Amends liquor license application and operating procedures to allow publicly-traded companies, or entities ultimately solely owned by a publicly-traded company, to provide information for only those officers designated as primary decisionmakers regarding the purchase and sale of liquor and clarifies that the requirement of prior approval from a county liquor commission regarding a change in ownership of at least twenty-five percent of a corporation's outstanding capital stock applies only to voting stock. Allows the applicant for a liquor license or renewal, or both the transferor and transferee in the case of a liquor license transfer, to present a tax clearance certificate from the Department of Taxation and the Internal Revenue Service evidencing that the applicant, transferor, and transferee do not owe the State or federal government any delinquent taxes, penalties, or interest. (HB2422 HD1)

2305.last_action: Referred to AGR, FIN, referral sheet 5
2305.title: Special Purpose Revenue Bonds; Keahole Management Group, LLC ($)

Requires a survey of available state property for affordable rental housing. Requires DHS to conduct a homeless summit. Provides job assistance for homeless individuals. Appropriates moneys.

2312.title: Licensing; Applicants for Licensure; Competency; Discipline; Summary Suspension; Hearing; Board of Dental Examiners; Hawaii Medical Board; Board of Nursing; Board of Pharmacy
2312.description: Requires dentist, physician, osteopathic physician, physician assistant, nurse, and pharmacist licensee applicants who have had a license, permit, or ability to practice suspended in another jurisdiction to undergo a hearing to show cause why suspension should be terminated prior to being issued a license to practice in Hawaii. Requires the board of dental examiners, Hawaii medical board, board of nursing, and board of pharmacy to summarily suspend a Hawaii license upon a determination that a licensee has had a license, registration, or ability to practice suspended or revoked in any other jurisdiction, pending a hearing to show cause. Requires orders of summary suspension or disciplinary action taken due to actions arising in other jurisdictions to be public record.

2408.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the 27th representative district.

2421.description: Authorizes insurers, mutual benefit societies, and health maintenance organizations to offer, sell, or renew, on or after January 1, 2017, a high deductible health plan in conjunction with a health savings account to an employer subject to the prepaid health care act together with a prepaid health care plan insurance policy, which is not a high deductible health plan, that has been sold to the employer. Requires a preliminary report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of the regular session of 2018 and a final report no later than twenty days prior to the convening of the regular session of 2021. 2435.description: Requires the Agribusiness Development Corporation to prepare for the closure of the HC&S thirty-six thousand-acre sugar plantation on Maui by, among other things, monitoring the closure; identifying suitable lands for acquisition by the State; and investigating the means necessary to develop and sustain diversified agriculture on the former sugarcane lands. 2436.description: Establishes and designates American Sign Language as a language distinct from English and Hawaiian. (HB2554 HD2)

2439.title: Emergency Vehicles; Sirens; Best Practices
2439.description: Clarifies that the use of sirens by a driver of an emergency vehicle is discretionary and must follow the best practices of the driver's profession.

2440.title: State Employees; Air Travel; DLNR; Carbon Offset Program
2440.description: Requires state agencies to participate in a carbon offset program to offset carbon emissions caused by their employees' air travel. Requires DLNR to establish and administer a carbon offset program. (HB2558 HD1)

2441.title: Mental Health; Assisted Community Treatment
2441.description: Repeals the authority of a law enforcement officer to take into custody and transport a person subject to an assisted community treatment order to any designated mental health program. Requires a court order stating probable cause to believe a person is mentally ill or suffering from substance abuse, is imminently dangerous to self or others and in need of care or treatment, or both, to also direct the person to be taken into custody and, if subject to an assisted community treatment order, transported to any designated mental health program. Extends the maximum duration of assisted community treatment that may be ordered by the court to one year. Narrows the circumstances under which a subject of an assisted community treatment order may be physically forced to take medication to require the subject to be physically present in an emergency room or admitted to a hospital. Repeals the sunset date of the current statutory requirements for assisted community treatment. (HB2559 CD1)

2442.title: Corporation Reports; Independent Campaign Expenditures and Political Contributions
2442.description: Requires domestic and foreign corporations to provide their shareholders with reports of independent expenditures and political contributions. (HB2560 HD2)

2589.title: Medical Marijuana; Dispensaries; Paraphernalia; Taxation; Working Group
2589.description: Requires the department of health and licensed medical marijuana dispensaries to provide aggregated de-identified data to the department of business, economic development, and tourism upon request. Amends various definitions and provisions relating to medical marijuana dispensary background checks, operations, paraphernalia, transport, and testing. Provides that advanced practice registered nurses may certify patients for medical marijuana use. Excludes dispensaries from enterprise zone tax exemptions. Specifies the application and non-application of the Internal Revenue Code to expenses related to the production and sale of medical marijuana and manufactured marijuana products for state income tax purposes. Clarifies that amounts received for the sale of marijuana or manufactured marijuana products are not exempt from the state general excise tax. Establishes definition of marijuana "plant". Amends definition of "enclosed indoor facility." Clarifies which medical marijuana dispensary licensees and applicants are subject to background checks. Allows the University of Hawaii to establish medical marijuana testing and research programs that qualify as commercial enterprises to provide testing services for medical marijuana dispensaries. Establishes a legislative oversight working group. (CD1)

2622.title: Preauthorization; Health Insurance; Health Insurers; Standards; Establishment; Medical Treatment or Service; Guidelines
2622.description: Establishes preauthorization standards for all health insurers in the State, including health benefits plans under chapter 87A, HRS. Requires preauthorization requests for medical treatment or service to be consistent with known, published, and current evidence-based appropriate-use criteria or guidelines for the appropriate specialty or subspecialty for which the preauthorization is requested. Specifies requirements for insurers that require preauthorization. Specifies that preauthorization is not required for delivery of emergency medical services. Requires decisions on preauthorization requests to be made in accordance with nationally-accepted evidence-based appropriate-use criteria or guidelines and made available to health care providers within a health insurer's network. Requires that licensed health care providers be defended and indemnified by an insurer for civil liability for injury to a patient that was caused by the insurer's undue delay in preauthorization. Establishes that an insurer that fails to meet the standards is civilly liable for any injury that occurs to a patient due to undue delay in receipt of medical treatment or services. Specifies that an insurer is not prohibited from implementing preauthorization or otherwise meeting established requirements for preauthorization, as required under existing state or federal programs. Requires the insurance commissioner to submit a report to the legislature. Sunsets 7/1/2019. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

2932.description: Requesting The Department Of Health To Convene A Science Advisory Group Of Experts Specializing In The Development Of Tests For Emerging Infectious Diseases.

2933.last_action: Referred to WAL, FIN, referral sheet 28
2933.title: State Archives; New Building; Department of Accounting and General Services; Comptroller; Library; Library
2933.description: State Archives; New Building; Department of Accounting and General Services; Comptroller; Library; Library

2939.last_action: The committee(s) on TRN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2939.title: Kamehameha Highway; Study
2939.description: Requesting The Department Of Transportation To Perform A Comprehensive Study Of The Kamehameha Highway Along The Windward And North Shores Of Oahu.

2945.last_action: Referred to PBS, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 28
2945.title: Habitual offender registry
2945.description: Urging The Department Of Public Safety To Establish A Habitual Criminal Offender Registry.

2948.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT/HUS recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2948.title: Fair Labor Standards Act; Minimum Wage; Overtime Pay; Casual Babysitters; Domestic Service Workers; Essential Home Care Services; Healthcare;
2948.description: Requesting The Director Of Health To Establish A Fair Labor Home Care Services Task Force To Examine The Impact Of The Federal Regulation Extending Minimum Wage And Overtime Pay Protections Under The Federal Labor Standards Act To Workers Who Provide Essential Home Care Services To Persons With Disabilities And Older Adults.

2949.title: Capitol Security Plan
2949.description: Requesting The Department Of Public Safety To Consult With The State Capitol Management Committee And To Develop And Implement A Master Security Plan That Will Increase Safety And Security In The State Capitol Building Through The Use Of Metal Detectors, X-ray Scans Of Baggage, And Other Prudent Measures.

2955.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2955.title: Legacy Tree Reso
2955.description: Urging Support For The Hawaiian Legacy Reforestation Initiative.

2957.last_action: Received notice of Adoption in House (Hse. Com. No. 663).
2957.title: Taiwan; Endorsement of Taiwan's Participation in International Organizations
2957.description: Endorsing Taiwan's Participation As An Observer In The United Nations Framework Convention On Climate Change, International Civil Aviation Organization, World Health Organization, And International Criminal Police Organization And Supporting The State Of Hawaii's Twenty-third Anniversary Of Sister-state Relations With Taiwan.

2961.last_action: Received notice of Adoption in House (Hse. Com. No. 667).
2961.title: Impact on State Government of Decriminalization of Illegal Possession of Drugs; Study
2961.description: Requesting The Legislative Reference Bureau To Conduct A Study On The Potential Impact On Administrative And Judicial Systems Of State Government Of Decriminalizing The Illegal Possession Of Drugs For Personal Use In Hawaii.

2969.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT/CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2969.title: DCCA Health Care Task Force
2969.description: Requesting The Department Of Commerce And Consumer Affairs To Establish A Health Care Task Force Within The Insurance Division To Develop A Plan To Improve The Delivery Of Health Care In The State.

2977.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2977.title: Transfer of the Licensing and Regulation Program for Private Trade, Vocational, and Technical Schools; Department of Education; University of Hawaii; Auditor; Sunrise Review and Feasibility Study
2977.description: Requesting The Office Of The Auditor To Conduct A Sunrise Review And Feasibility Study Of The Transfer Of The Licensing And Regulation Program For Private Trade, Vocational, And Technical Schools From The Department Of Education To The University Of Hawaii.

2984.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Ing, Kong, Luke, Saiki, Thielen, Tokioka excused (7).
2984.title: Department of Education; Civil Rights Compliance Office; Audit
2984.description: Requesting The Office Of The Auditor To Conduct An Audit Of The Civil Rights Compliance Office Of The Department Of Education.

2991.last_action: Received notice of Adoption in House (Hse. Com. No. 663).
2991.title: Accountable Care Organizations; Direct Primary Care; Concierge Medicine; Insurance Division
2991.description: Requesting The Insurance Division Of The Department Of Commerce And Consumer Affairs To Collaborate With The Medical Professional Community On A Survey To Determine The Extent Of The Development Of Accountable Care Organizations And Direct Primary Care Or Concierge Medicine Within The Community And The Impact Of These Business Arrangements On The Ability Of Patients To Access Primary Care Services In The State.

2995.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on WAL with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Kawakami, Kobayashi, Kong, Luke, Pouha, Rhoads excused (6).
2995.title: Senator Gilbert Kahele Monument; DLNR
2995.description: Requesting The Department Of Land And Natural Resources To Authorize The Establishment Of A Monument In Hilo On State Land In Honor Of The Late Senator Gilbert Kahele.

3015.last_action: Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Ing, Kong, Luke, Saiki, Thielen, Tokioka excused (7).
3015.title: Easement; State Submerged Lands; Puamana, Lahaina, Maui
3015.description: Authorizing The Issuance Of A Non-exclusive Easement Covering A Portion Of State Submerged Lands At Puamana, Lahaina, Maui, For Various Seawall Structures, A Concrete Groin, And Revetment Footings Of A Historic Swimming Pool.

3016.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
3016.title: Chip and PIN Cards; Chip-and-PIN Cards; Electronic Payment; Credit Cards; Debit Cards; Security
3016.description: Supporting The Adoption Of Chip And Pin Technology By All Financial Institutions To Improve The Security Of Consumer Financial Transactions In The State.

3017.last_action: The committee(s) on VMI recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
3017.title: Makua Valley; Military
3017.description: Requesting The United States Army To Complete The Makua Valley Environmental Impact Statement, Halt All Activities In Makua Valley, And Initiate Clean Up To Return Makua Valley To Families Who Lost Their Homelands Generations Ago.

3022.last_action: Received notice of Adoption in House (Hse. Com. No. 663).
3022.title: Public Land Trust Revenues Negotiating Committee
3022.description: Urging The Convening Of A Public Land Trust Revenues Negotiating Committee.

3028.last_action: Referred to LMG, FIN, referral sheet 28
3028.title: State Capitol Management Committee; Master Security Plan
3028.description: Requesting The State Capitol Management Committee To Develop And Implement A Master Security Plan.

3039.last_action: Referred to EDN, FIN, referral sheet 28
3039.title: REDUCE STANDARDIZED TESTING IN PUBLIC EDUCATION SYSTEM.
3039.description: Requesting The Board Of Education And Department Of Education To Reduce The Use Of Standardized Testing In The Public Education System.

3041.title: Appointment of Auditor, LRB Director, Ombudsman
3041.description: Calling For A Joint Session Of The Legislature For The Purpose Of Appointing The Ombudsman, The Director Of The Legislative Reference Bureau, And The Auditor.

3042.title: Research Corporation of the University of Hawaii; Procurement Exemption
3042.description: Limits RCUH's procurement exemption to contracts that are directly related to research, contracts for investigations, training, and studies that are directly related to research.

3043.title: Boards and Commissions; Absences; Vacancies
3043.description: Requires a board chair to provide notice to a board member who fails to attend four consecutive duly noticed meetings.
